sentences.zh: 趙氏之先，與秦共祖。

translations.literal: Zhao clan's forebears, together with Qin shared ancestor.
translations.idiomatic: The forebears of the Zhao clan shared a common ancestor with Qin.

sentences.zh: 至中衍，為帝大戊御。

translations.literal: Reached Zhong Yan, was Emperor Da Wu's charioteer.
translations.idiomatic: The line reached Zhong Yan, who served as Emperor Da Wu's charioteer.

sentences.zh: 其後世蜚廉有子二人，而命其一子曰惡來，事紂，為周所殺，其後為秦。

translations.literal: His later generations Feilian had sons two, and named his one son said Elai, served Zhou, was by Zhou killed, his descendants became Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In later generations, Feilian had two sons. He named one son Elai, who served King Zhou but was killed by the Zhou. His descendants became the Qin clan.

sentences.zh: 惡來弟曰季勝，其後為趙。

translations.literal: Elai's younger brother named Jisheng, his descendants became Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Elai's younger brother was named Jisheng. His descendants became the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 季勝生孟增。

translations.literal: Jisheng begat Mengzeng.
translations.idiomatic: Jisheng begat Mengzeng.

sentences.zh: 孟增幸於周成王，是為宅皋狼。

translations.literal: Mengzeng favored by Zhou Cheng Wang, this was Zhaigaolang.
translations.idiomatic: Mengzeng found favor with King Cheng of Zhou and became known as Zhaigaolang.

sentences.zh: 皋狼生衡父，衡父生造父。

translations.literal: Gaolang begat Hengfu, Hengfu begat Zaofu.
translations.idiomatic: Gaolang begat Hengfu, who begat Zaofu.

sentences.zh: 造父幸於周繆王。

translations.literal: Zaofu favored by Zhou Mu Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zaofu found favor with King Mu of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 造父取驥之乘匹，與桃林盜驪、驊騮、綠耳，獻之繆王。

translations.literal: Zaofu took Ji's chariot team, together with Taolin's stolen Lilu, Hualiu, Lver, presented them to Mu Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zaofu acquired Ji's chariot team, along with the stolen horses Lilu, Hualiu, and Lver from Taolin, and presented them all to King Mu.

sentences.zh: 繆王使造父御，西巡狩，見西王母，樂之忘歸。

translations.literal: Mu Wang made Zaofu drive, west toured, saw Xi Wang Mu, enjoyed it forgot return.
translations.idiomatic: King Mu had Zaofu drive his chariot on a western tour. They met the Queen Mother of the West, and he enjoyed it so much he forgot to return.

sentences.zh: 而徐偃王反，繆王日馳千里馬，攻徐偃王，大破之。

translations.literal: While Xu Yan Wang rebelled, Mu Wang daily galloped thousand li horses, attacked Xu Yan Wang, greatly defeated him.
translations.idiomatic: Meanwhile, King Yan of Xu rebelled. King Mu rode his thousand-li horses each day to attack King Yan of Xu and decisively defeated him.

sentences.zh: 乃賜造父以趙城，由此為趙氏。

translations.literal: Then granted Zaofu Zhao city, from this became Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: He then granted Zaofu the city of Zhao. From this time onward, they became the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 自造父已下六世至奄父，曰公仲，周宣王時伐戎，為御。

translations.literal: From Zaofu below six generations to Yanfu, called Gongzhong, Zhou Xuan Wang time attacked Rong, was charioteer.
translations.idiomatic: Six generations after Zaofu came Yanfu, also known as Gongzhong. During King Xuan of Zhou's reign, he campaigned against the Rong and served as charioteer.

sentences.zh: 及千畝戰，奄父脫宣王。

translations.literal: When Qianmu battle, Yanfu rescued Xuan Wang.
translations.idiomatic: During the battle at Qianmu, Yanfu rescued King Xuan.

sentences.zh: 奄父生叔帶。

translations.literal: Yanfu begat Shudai.
translations.idiomatic: Yanfu begat Shudai.

sentences.zh: 叔帶之時，周幽王無道，去周如晉，事晉文侯，始建趙氏于晉國。

translations.literal: Shudai's time, Zhou You Wang without way, left Zhou went to Jin, served Jin Wen Hou, began building Zhao clan in Jin state.
translations.idiomatic: During Shudai's time, King You of Zhou was tyrannical. He left Zhou and went to Jin, served Duke Wen of Jin, and first established the Zhao clan in the state of Jin.

sentences.zh: 自叔帶以下，趙宗益興，五世而（生）［至］趙夙。

translations.literal: From Shudai below, Zhao lineage increasingly flourished, five generations then reached Zhao Shu.
translations.idiomatic: From Shudai onward, the Zhao lineage grew increasingly prominent, and after five generations reached Zhao Shu.

sentences.zh: 趙夙，晉獻公之十六年伐霍、魏、耿，而趙夙為將伐霍。

translations.literal: Zhao Shu, Jin Xian Gong's sixteenth year attacked Huo, Wei, Geng, and Zhao Shu was general attacked Huo.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shu, in Duke Xian of Jin's sixteenth year, attacked Huo, Wei, and Geng. Zhao Shu was the general who attacked Huo.

sentences.zh: 霍公求奔齊。

translations.literal: Huo Gong Qiu fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Qiu of Huo fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 晉大旱，卜之，曰「霍太山為祟」。

translations.literal: Jin great drought, divined it, said 'Huo Taishan is causing the trouble.'
translations.idiomatic: Jin suffered a great drought. They divined the cause and were told, 'Mount Tai of Huo is causing this calamity.'

sentences.zh: 使趙夙召霍君於齊，復之，以奉霍太山之祀，晉復穰。

translations.literal: Made Zhao Shu summon Huo lord from Qi, restored him, to offer Huo Taishan's sacrifices, Jin again prosperous.
translations.idiomatic: They sent Zhao Shu to summon the Lord of Huo from Qi and restore him, so that he could offer sacrifices to Mount Tai of Huo. Jin became prosperous again.

sentences.zh: 晉獻公賜趙夙耿。

translations.literal: Jin Xian Gong granted Zhao Shu Geng.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian of Jin granted Zhao Shu the city of Geng.

sentences.zh: 夙生共孟，當魯閔公之元年也。

translations.literal: Shu begat Gong Meng, was in Lu Min Gong's first year.
translations.idiomatic: Shu begat Gong Meng, which was in the first year of Duke Min of Lu.

sentences.zh: 共孟生趙衰，字子餘。

translations.literal: Gong Meng begat Zhao Shuai, styled Ziyv.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Meng begat Zhao Shuai, whose courtesy name was Ziyv.

sentences.zh: 趙衰卜事晉獻公及諸公子，莫吉；

translations.literal: Zhao Shuai divined serving Jin Xian Gong and various princes, none auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuai divined about serving Duke Xian of Jin and the various princes, but none of the divinations were auspicious.

sentences.zh: 卜事公子重耳，吉，即事重耳。

translations.literal: Divined serving Prince Chong'er, auspicious, then served Chong'er.
translations.idiomatic: When he divined about serving Prince Chong'er, it was auspicious, so he served Chong'er.

sentences.zh: 重耳以驪姬之亂亡奔翟，趙衰從。

translations.literal: Chong'er because of Li Ji's disorder fled to Di, Zhao Shuai followed.
translations.idiomatic: Because of the disorder caused by Lady Li, Chong'er fled to the Di. Zhao Shuai followed him.

sentences.zh: 翟伐廧咎如，得二女，翟以其少女妻重耳，長女妻趙衰而生盾。

translations.literal: Di attacked Xia Jiuru, obtained two women, Di with their younger daughter married Chong'er, elder daughter married Zhao Shuai and gave birth to Dun.
translations.idiomatic: The Di attacked Xia Jiuru and obtained two women. The Di gave their younger daughter to Chong'er as wife, and gave the elder daughter to Zhao Shuai as wife. She gave birth to Dun.

sentences.zh: 初，重耳在晉時，趙衰妻亦生趙同、趙括、趙嬰齊。

translations.literal: Initially, when Chong'er was in Jin, Zhao Shuai's wife also gave birth to Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Yingqi.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Chong'er was still in Jin, Zhao Shuai's wife also gave birth to Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, and Zhao Yingqi.

sentences.zh: 趙衰從重耳出亡，凡十九年，得反國。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuai followed Chong'er went into exile, altogether nineteen years, got to return to country.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuai followed Chong'er into exile. After nineteen years altogether, they were able to return to the state.

sentences.zh: 重耳為晉文公，趙衰為原大夫，居原，任國政。

translations.literal: Chong'er became Jin Wen Gong, Zhao Shuai became Yuan grand master, resided in Yuan, took charge of state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Chong'er became Duke Wen of Jin. Zhao Shuai became the grand master of Yuan, resided in Yuan, and took charge of state affairs.

sentences.zh: 文公所以反國及霸，多趙衰計策，語在晉事中。

translations.literal: Wen Gong's return to country and hegemony, mostly Zhao Shuai's strategies, speech in Jin matters middle.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen's return to the state and his hegemony were mostly due to Zhao Shuai's strategies. This is recorded in the Jin annals.

sentences.zh: 趙衰既反晉，晉之妻固要迎翟妻，而以其子盾為適嗣，晉妻三子皆下事之。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuai having returned to Jin, Jin's wife strongly demanded to welcome Di wife, and made her son Dun the proper heir, Jin wife's three sons all served below him.
translations.idiomatic: After Zhao Shuai returned to Jin, Duke Wen's wife strongly insisted on welcoming the Di wife, and made her son Dun the proper heir. Duke Wen's wife's three sons all served below him.

sentences.zh: 晉襄公之六年，而趙衰卒，謚為成季。

translations.literal: Jin Xiang Gong's sixth year, and Zhao Shuai died, posthumous name Cheng Ji.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year of Duke Xiang of Jin, Zhao Shuai died. His posthumous name was Cheng Ji.

sentences.zh: 趙盾代成季任國政二年而晉襄公卒，太子夷皋年少。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun replaced Cheng Ji took charge of state affairs two years and Jin Xiang Gong died, Crown Prince Yi Gao young.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun replaced Cheng Ji and took charge of state affairs. Two years later, Duke Xiang of Jin died. Crown Prince Yi Gao was young.

sentences.zh: 盾為國多難，欲立襄公弟雍。

translations.literal: Dun for country's many difficulties, wished to establish Xiang Gong's younger brother Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Because the state had many difficulties, Dun wished to establish Duke Xiang's younger brother Yong as ruler.

sentences.zh: 雍時在秦，使使迎之。

translations.literal: Yong at that time in Qin, sent envoy welcomed him.
translations.idiomatic: Yong was then in Qin, so they sent an envoy to welcome him.

sentences.zh: 太子母日夜啼泣，頓首謂趙盾曰：「先君何罪，釋其適子而更求君？」

translations.literal: Crown Prince's mother day and night wept and wailed, kowtowed said to Zhao Dun: 'Former lord what crime, abandon his proper son and seek another lord?'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince's mother wept and wailed day and night. She kowtowed and said to Zhao Dun, 'What crime did the former lord commit? Why abandon his proper son and seek another lord?'

sentences.zh: 趙盾患之，恐其宗與大夫襲誅之，乃遂立太子，是為靈公，發兵距所迎襄公弟於秦者。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun worried about it, feared his clan and grand masters would suddenly execute him, then established the crown prince, this was Ling Gong, sent troops to block those welcoming Xiang Gong's younger brother from Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun was troubled by this. He feared that his clan and the grand masters would suddenly execute him. So he established the crown prince as ruler. This was Duke Ling. He sent troops to block those who were welcoming Duke Xiang's younger brother from Qin.

sentences.zh: 靈公既立，趙盾益專國政。

translations.literal: Ling Gong having been established, Zhao Dun increasingly monopolized state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: After Duke Ling was established as ruler, Zhao Dun increasingly monopolized control of state affairs.

sentences.zh: 靈公立十四年，益驕。

translations.literal: Ling Gong established fourteen years, increasingly arrogant.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling had been on the throne for fourteen years and grew increasingly arrogant.

sentences.zh: 趙盾驟諫，靈公弗聽。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun repeatedly admonished, Ling Gong did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun repeatedly admonished him, but Duke Ling would not listen.

sentences.zh: 及食熊蹯，胹不熟，殺宰人，持其尸出，趙盾見之。

translations.literal: When eating bear's paw, stew not cooked, killed the butcher, carried his corpse out, Zhao Dun saw it.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Ling was eating bear's paw, the stew was not cooked. He killed the butcher and had his corpse carried out. Zhao Dun saw this.

sentences.zh: 靈公由此懼，欲殺盾。

translations.literal: Ling Gong from this feared, wished to kill Dun.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling became fearful because of this and wished to kill Dun.

sentences.zh: 盾素仁愛人，嘗所食桑下餓人反捍救盾，盾以得亡。

translations.literal: Dun usually benevolent loved people, once the hungry person under mulberry tree he fed returned protected saved Dun, Dun thereby got to escape.
translations.idiomatic: Dun was usually benevolent and loved people. Once, a hungry person he had fed under a mulberry tree returned and protected him, saving Dun. This is how Dun was able to escape.

sentences.zh: 未出境，而趙穿弒靈公而立襄公弟黑臀，是為成公。

translations.literal: Not yet out of borders, and Zhao Chuan assassinated Ling Gong and established Xiang Gong's younger brother Heitun, this was Cheng Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Before Zhao Dun had even left the borders, Zhao Chuan assassinated Duke Ling and established Duke Xiang's younger brother Heitun as ruler. This was Duke Cheng.

sentences.zh: 趙盾復反，任國政。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun again returned, took charge of state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun returned again and took charge of state affairs.

sentences.zh: 君子譏盾「為正卿，亡不出境，反不討賊」，故太史書曰「趙盾弒其君」。

translations.literal: Gentleman criticized Dun 'as chief minister, exile not out of borders, return not punish traitor', therefore grand scribe wrote said 'Zhao Dun assassinated his lord'.
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman criticized Zhao Dun, saying, 'As chief minister, when his lord went into exile, he did not leave the borders with him. When he returned, he did not punish the traitor.' Therefore, the grand scribe wrote, 'Zhao Dun assassinated his lord.'

sentences.zh: 晉景公時而趙盾卒，謚為宣孟，子朔嗣。

translations.literal: Jin Jing Gong time and Zhao Dun died, posthumous name Xuan Meng, son Shuo succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: During the reign of Duke Jing of Jin, Zhao Dun died. His posthumous name was Xuan Meng. His son Zhao Shuo succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 趙朔，晉景公之三年，朔為晉將下軍救鄭，與楚莊王戰河上。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuo, Jin Jing Gong's third year, Shuo was Jin's lower army general saved Zheng, with Chu Zhuang Wang battled on Yellow River.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuo, in the third year of Duke Jing of Jin, served as the general of Jin's lower army to save Zheng. He battled King Zhuang of Chu on the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 朔娶晉成公姊為夫人。

translations.literal: Shuo married Jin Cheng Gong's elder sister as wife.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuo married Duke Cheng of Jin's elder sister as his wife.

sentences.zh: 晉景公之三年，大夫屠岸賈欲誅趙氏。

translations.literal: Jin Jing Gong's third year, grand master Tu An Jia wished to execute Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year of Duke Jing of Jin, the grand master Tu Anjia wished to execute the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 初，趙盾在時，夢見叔帶持要而哭，甚悲；

translations.literal: Initially, when Zhao Dun was alive, dreamed saw Shudai held waist and cried, very sad.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, while Zhao Dun was still alive, he dreamed that he saw Shudai holding his waist and crying. It was very sorrowful.

sentences.zh: 已而笑，拊手且歌。

translations.literal: Then laughed, clapped hands and sang.
translations.idiomatic: Then he laughed, clapped his hands, and sang.

sentences.zh: 盾卜之，兆絕而後好。

translations.literal: Dun divined it, omen broken then afterwards good.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun divined about it. The omen was broken at first, but then became favorable.

sentences.zh: 趙史援占之，曰：「此夢甚惡，非君之身，乃君之子，然亦君之咎。

translations.literal: Zhao scribe Yuan interpreted it, said: 'This dream very bad, not lord's body, rather lord's son, yet also lord's fault.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao scribe Yuan interpreted it and said, 'This dream is very bad. It does not refer to your own body, but to your son's. However, it is also your own fault.'

sentences.zh: 至孫，趙將世益衰。」

translations.literal: Reach grandson, Zhao will generation increasingly decline.'
translations.idiomatic: 'It will reach your grandson. The Zhao clan will decline generation by generation.'

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈者，始有寵於靈公，及至於景公而賈為司寇，將作難，乃治靈公之賊以致趙盾，遍告諸將曰：「盾雖不知，猶為賊首。

translations.literal: Tu An Jia, initially had favor with Ling Gong, and reached Jing Gong and Jia was judicial minister, about to make disturbance, then investigated Ling Gong's assassin to implicate Zhao Dun, widely told various generals said: 'Dun though did not know, still was traitor head.
translations.idiomatic: Tu Anjia had initially found favor with Duke Ling. When Duke Jing's reign came, Jia became the judicial minister. He was about to stir up trouble, so he investigated Duke Ling's assassin to implicate Zhao Dun. He told all the generals, 'Even though Zhao Dun did not know about it, he was still the head of the traitors.'

sentences.zh: 以臣弒君，子孫在朝，何以懲罪？

translations.literal: With minister assassinated lord, descendants in court, how to punish crime?
translations.idiomatic: 'A minister assassinated his lord, yet his descendants remain in the court. How can we punish this crime?'

sentences.zh: 請誅之。」

translations.literal: Request execute them.'
translations.idiomatic: 'I request that they be executed.'

sentences.zh: 韓厥曰：「靈公遇賊，趙盾在外，吾先君以為無罪，故不誅。

translations.literal: Han Que said: 'Ling Gong encountered traitor, Zhao Dun outside, my former lord considered no crime, therefore did not execute.
translations.idiomatic: Han Que said, 'Duke Ling encountered a traitor. Zhao Dun was outside. My former lord considered him innocent, so he did not execute him.'

sentences.zh: 今諸君將誅其後，是非先君之意而今妄誅。

translations.literal: Now various lords about to execute his descendants, this not former lord's intention and now recklessly execute.
translations.idiomatic: Now you lords are about to execute his descendants. This is not my former lord's intention, and you are recklessly executing them now.'

sentences.zh: 妄誅謂之亂。

translations.literal: Reckless execution called disorder.
translations.idiomatic: Reckless execution is called disorder.'

sentences.zh: 臣有大事而君不聞，是無君也。」

translations.literal: Minister has great matter and lord not hear, this is without lord also.'
translations.idiomatic: 'A minister has a great matter and his lord does not hear about it. This means he has no lord.'

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈不聽。

translations.literal: Tu An Jia did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Tu Anjia did not listen.

sentences.zh: 韓厥告趙朔趣亡。

translations.literal: Han Que told Zhao Shuo hasten flee.
translations.idiomatic: Han Que told Zhao Shuo to hasten and flee.

sentences.zh: 朔不肯，曰：「子必不絕趙祀，朔死不恨。」

translations.literal: Shuo not willing, said: 'You must not cut off Zhao sacrifices, Shuo die without regret.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuo was not willing. He said, 'You must not cut off the Zhao sacrifices. I will die without regret.'

sentences.zh: 韓厥許諾，稱疾不出。

translations.literal: Han Que promised, claimed illness did not go out.
translations.idiomatic: Han Que promised and claimed illness so as not to go out.

sentences.zh: 賈不請而擅與諸將攻趙氏於下宮，殺趙朔、趙同、趙括、趙嬰齊，皆滅其族。

translations.literal: Jia not request and arbitrarily with various generals attacked Zhao clan at lower palace, killed Zhao Shuo, Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Yingqi, all extinguished their clans.
translations.idiomatic: Jia did not request permission but arbitrarily joined with the various generals to attack the Zhao clan at the lower palace. They killed Zhao Shuo, Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, and Zhao Yingqi. They extinguished all their clans.

sentences.zh: 趙朔妻成公姊，有遺腹，走公宮匿。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuo's wife Cheng Gong's elder sister, had posthumous child, fled ducal palace hid.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuo's wife, who was Duke Cheng's elder sister, had a posthumous child. She fled and hid in the ducal palace.

sentences.zh: 趙朔客曰公孫杵臼，杵臼謂朔友人程嬰曰：「胡不死？」

translations.literal: Zhao Shuo's guest called Gongsun Chujiu, Chujiu said to Shuo's friend Cheng Ying: 'Why not die?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuo's guest was named Gongsun Chujiu. Chujiu said to Zhao Shuo's friend Cheng Ying, 'Why don't you die?'

sentences.zh: 程嬰曰：「朔之婦有遺腹，若幸而男，吾奉之；

translations.literal: Cheng Ying said: 'Shuo's wife has posthumous child, if fortunately male, I will support him;
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Ying said, 'Zhao Shuo's wife has a posthumous child. If fortunately it's a boy, I will support him.'

sentences.zh: 即女也，吾徐死耳。」

translations.literal: If female also, I slowly die only.'
translations.idiomatic: 'If it's a girl, I will just die later.'

sentences.zh: 居無何，而朔婦免身，生男。

translations.literal: Resided not long, and Shuo's wife gave birth, bore male.
translations.idiomatic: Not long after, Zhao Shuo's wife gave birth to a boy.

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈聞之，索於宮中。

translations.literal: Tu An Jia heard it, searched in palace.
translations.idiomatic: Tu Anjia heard about it and searched within the palace.

sentences.zh: 夫人置兒叱罅祝曰：「趙宗滅乎，若號；

translations.literal: Lady placed child rebuked crevice priest said: 'Zhao lineage extinguished huh, if cry;
translations.idiomatic: The lady placed the child and rebuked the priest at the crevice, saying, 'Has the Zhao lineage been extinguished? If so, cry out.'

sentences.zh: 即不滅，若無聲。」

translations.literal: If not extinguished, if no sound.'
translations.idiomatic: 'If not extinguished, make no sound.'

sentences.zh: 及索，兒竟無聲。

translations.literal: When searched, child ultimately no sound.
translations.idiomatic: When they searched, the child made no sound at all.

sentences.zh: 已脫，程嬰謂公孫杵臼曰：「今一索不得，後必且復索之，柰何？」

translations.literal: Already escaped, Cheng Ying said to Gongsun Chujiu: 'Now one search not obtained, later must moreover again search it, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: Once they had escaped, Cheng Ying said to Gongsun Chujiu, 'Now that one search didn't find him, they will surely search again later. What should we do?'

sentences.zh: 公孫杵臼曰：「立孤與死孰難？」

translations.literal: Gongsun Chujiu said: 'Establish orphan with die which difficult?'
translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Chujiu said, 'Which is more difficult: establishing an orphan or dying?'

sentences.zh: 程嬰曰：「死易，立孤難耳。」

translations.literal: Cheng Ying said: 'Die easy, establish orphan difficult only.'
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Ying said, 'Dying is easy. Establishing an orphan is difficult.'

sentences.zh: 公孫杵臼曰：「趙氏先君遇子厚，子彊為其難者，吾為其易者，請先死。」

translations.literal: Gongsun Chujiu said: 'Zhao clan former lord treated you generously, you strong do its difficult ones, I do its easy ones, request first die.'
translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Chujiu said, 'The former lords of the Zhao clan treated you generously. You should take on the difficult task. I will take on the easy one. Let me die first.'

sentences.zh: 乃二人謀取他人嬰兒負之，衣以文葆，匿山中。

translations.literal: Then two people planned took other person's infant carried it, clothed with patterned quilt, hid mountain middle.
translations.idiomatic: So the two men planned to take another person's infant, carry it, clothe it in a patterned quilt, and hide it in the mountains.

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Yes, had it.
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi said, 'Yes, I had that.'

sentences.zh: 子之見我，我何為？」

translations.literal: You saw me, I what do?'
translations.idiomatic: You saw me there. What was I doing?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「帝令主君射熊與羆，皆死。」

translations.literal: Blocked road one said: 'Emperor commanded master lord shoot bear and pi, all died.'
translations.idiomatic: The one blocking the road said, 'The Emperor commanded my master lord to shoot the bear and the pi. They all died.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「是，且何也？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'This, moreover what huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi said, 'That's right. And what else?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「晉國且有大難，主君首之。

translations.literal: Blocked road one said: 'Jin state moreover has great difficulty, master lord heads it.
translations.idiomatic: The one blocking the road said, 'Jin will have great difficulties. My master lord will head them.'

sentences.zh: 帝令主君滅二卿，夫熊與羆皆其祖也。」

translations.literal: Emperor commanded master lord extinguish two ministers, indeed bear and pi all their ancestors also.'
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor commanded my master lord to extinguish two ministers. Indeed, the bear and the pi were their ancestors.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「帝賜我二笥皆有副，何也？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Emperor granted me two si all had deputy, what huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi said, 'The Emperor granted me two si, each with a deputy. What does that mean?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「主君之子將克二國於翟，皆子姓也。」

translations.literal: Blocked road one said: 'Master lord's son will conquer two countries in Di, all Zi surname also.'
translations.idiomatic: The one blocking the road said, 'My master lord's son will conquer two countries in the Di region. They all have the Zi surname.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「吾見兒在帝側，帝屬我一翟犬，曰『及而子之長以賜之』。

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'I saw child at Emperor side, Emperor entrusted me one Di dog, said 'when your son's grown with grant him'.
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi said, 'I saw a child at the Emperor's side. The Emperor entrusted me with a Di dog, saying, "When your son grows up, grant it to him."'

sentences.zh: 夫兒何謂以賜翟犬？」

translations.literal: Indeed child what called with grant Di dog?'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, what does the child have to do with granting the Di dog?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「兒，主君之子也。

translations.literal: Blocked road one said: 'Child, master lord's son also.
translations.idiomatic: The one blocking the road said, 'The child is my master lord's son.'

sentences.zh: 翟犬者，代之先也。

translations.literal: Di dog ones, Dai's ancestors also.
translations.idiomatic: The Di dogs were the ancestors of Dai.

sentences.zh: 主君之子且必有代。

translations.literal: Master lord's son moreover must have Dai.
translations.idiomatic: My master lord's son will certainly have Dai.

sentences.zh: 及主君之後嗣，且有革政而胡服，并二國於翟。」

translations.literal: Reach master lord's later successors, moreover will have change governance and barbarian clothing, merge two countries in Di.'
translations.idiomatic: When it reaches my master lord's later successors, they will change the governance and adopt barbarian clothing, merging two countries in the Di region.'

sentences.zh: 簡子問其姓而延之以官。

translations.literal: Jian Zi asked his surname and invited him with office.
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi asked his surname and invited him to take office.

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「臣野人，致帝命耳。」

translations.literal: Blocked road one said: 'Minister rustic person, convey Emperor command only.'
translations.idiomatic: The one blocking the road said, 'I am a rustic. I only convey the Emperor's commands.'

sentences.zh: 遂不見。

translations.literal: Then not seen.
translations.idiomatic: Then he was not seen again.

sentences.zh: 簡子書藏之府。

translations.literal: Jian Zi wrote hid it treasury.
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi wrote it down and hid it in his treasury.

sentences.zh: 異日，姑布子卿見簡子，簡子遍召諸子相之。

translations.literal: Different day, Gu Bu Zi Qing saw Jian Zi, Jian Zi universally summoned various sons examine their physiognomy.
translations.idiomatic: Another day, Gu Bu Zi Qing saw Jianzi. Jianzi summoned all his sons for him to examine their physiognomy.

sentences.zh: 子卿曰：「無為將軍者。」

translations.literal: Zi Qing said: 'None are general material.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Qing said, 'None of them are fit to be generals.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「趙氏其滅乎？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Zhao clan perhaps extinguish huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi said, 'Will the Zhao clan perhaps be extinguished?'

sentences.zh: 子卿曰：「吾嘗見一子於路，殆君之子也。」

translations.literal: Zi Qing said: 'I once saw one son on road, perhaps lord's son also.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Qing said, 'I once saw a boy on the road. He is perhaps your son.'

sentences.zh: 簡子召子毋卹。

translations.literal: Jian Zi summoned Zi Wu Xu.
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi summoned Zi Wu Xu.

sentences.zh: 毋卹至，則子卿起曰：「此真將軍矣！」

translations.literal: Wu Xu arrived, then Zi Qing rose said: 'This truly general already!'
translations.idiomatic: When Wu Xu arrived, Zi Qing stood up and said, 'This is truly a general!'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「此其母賤，翟婢也，奚道貴哉？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'This his mother base, Di slave also, how way noble huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi said, 'His mother is of low status. She is a Di slave. How could he be noble?'

sentences.zh: 子卿曰：「天所授，雖賤必貴。」

translations.literal: Zi Qing said: 'Heaven bestowed, though base must noble.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Qing said, 'Heaven has bestowed this. Though of base birth, he will certainly be noble.'

sentences.zh: 自是之後，簡子盡召諸子與語，毋卹最賢。

translations.literal: From this after, Jian Zi completely summoned various sons and spoke with them, Wu Xu most worthy.
translations.idiomatic: From that point on, Jianzi summoned all his sons to speak with them. Wu Xu was the most worthy.

sentences.zh: 簡子乃告諸子曰：「吾藏寶符於常山上，先得者賞。」

translations.literal: Jian Zi then told various sons said: 'I hide treasure talisman on Chang Shan top, first obtainer reward.'
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi then told his sons, 'I have hidden a treasure talisman on top of Chang Shan. Whoever gets it first will be rewarded.'

sentences.zh: 諸子馳之常山上，求，無所得。

translations.literal: Various sons galloped to Chang Shan top, sought, nothing obtained.
translations.idiomatic: His sons galloped to the top of Chang Shan and searched, but found nothing.

sentences.zh: 毋卹還，曰：「已得符矣。」

translations.literal: Wu Xu returned, said: 'Already obtained talisman already.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Xu returned and said, 'I have already obtained the talisman.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「奏之。」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Present it.'
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi said, 'Present it.'

sentences.zh: 毋卹曰：「從常山上臨代，代可取也。」

translations.literal: Wu Xu said: 'From Chang Shan top overlook Dai, Dai can take also.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Xu said, 'From the top of Chang Shan one can overlook Dai. Dai can be taken.'

sentences.zh: 簡子於是知毋卹果賢，乃廢太子伯魯，而以毋卹為太子。

translations.literal: Jian Zi thereupon knew Wu Xu indeed worthy, then abolished crown prince Bo Lu, and with Wu Xu as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi thereupon knew that Wu Xu was indeed worthy. He abolished the crown prince Bo Lu and made Wu Xu crown prince instead.

sentences.zh: 後二年，晉定公之十四年，范、中行作亂。

translations.literal: Later two years, Jin Ding Gong's fourteenth year, Fan, Zhong Xing made rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Two years later, in the fourteenth year of Duke Ding of Jin, the Fan and Zhongxing clans rebelled.

sentences.zh: 明年春，簡子謂邯鄲大夫午曰：「歸我衛士五百家，吾將置之晉陽。」

translations.literal: Next year spring, Jian Zi told Han Dan grand master Wu said: 'Return me Wei soldiers five hundred households, I will place them Jin Yang.'
translations.idiomatic: The following spring, Jianzi told the grand master of Handan, Wu, 'Return to me five hundred households of Wei soldiers. I will station them in Jinyang.'

sentences.zh: 午許諾，歸而其父兄不聽，倍言。

translations.literal: Wu promised, returned and his father elder brothers not listen, doubled words.
translations.idiomatic: Wu promised, but when he returned home his father and elder brothers would not listen and contradicted him.

sentences.zh: 趙鞅捕午，囚之晉陽。

translations.literal: Zhao Yang captured Wu, imprisoned him Jin Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang captured Wu and imprisoned him in Jinyang.

sentences.zh: 乃告邯鄲人曰：「我私有誅午也，諸君欲誰立？」

translations.literal: Then told Han Dan people said: 'I privately have executed Wu also, various lords wish who establish?'
translations.idiomatic: He then told the people of Handan, 'I have privately executed Wu. Whom do you gentlemen wish to establish as ruler?'

sentences.zh: 遂殺午。

translations.literal: Then killed Wu.
translations.idiomatic: He then killed Wu.

sentences.zh: 趙稷、涉賓以邯鄲反。

translations.literal: Zhao Ji, She Bin with Han Dan rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Ji and She Bin rebelled, using Handan as their base.

sentences.zh: 晉君使籍秦圍邯鄲。

translations.literal: Jin lord sent Ji Qin surround Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: The lord of Jin sent Ji Qin to besiege Handan.

sentences.zh: 荀寅、范吉射與午善，不肯助秦而謀作亂，董安于知之。

translations.literal: Xun Yin, Fan Ji She with Wu friendly, not willing assist Qin and planned make rebellion, Dong An Yu knew it.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Yin and Fan Ji She were friendly with Wu. They were unwilling to help Qin and planned to rebel. Dong Anyu knew of this.

sentences.zh: 十月，范、中行氏伐趙鞅，鞅奔晉陽，晉人圍之。

translations.literal: Tenth month, Fan, Zhong Xing clan attacked Zhao Yang, Yang fled Jin Yang, Jin people surrounded him.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, the Fan and Zhongxing clans attacked Zhao Yang. Yang fled to Jinyang, and the Jin people besieged him.

sentences.zh: 范吉射、荀寅仇人魏襄等謀逐荀寅，以梁嬰父代之；

translations.literal: Fan Ji She, Xun Yin enemy Wei Xiang etc. planned expel Xun Yin, with Liang Ying Fu replace him;
translations.idiomatic: Fan Ji She and Xun Yin's enemies, including Wei Xiang and others, planned to expel Xun Yin and replace him with Liang Yingfu;

sentences.zh: 逐吉射，以范皋繹代之。

translations.literal: Expelled Ji She, with Fan Gao Xi replace him.
translations.idiomatic: They expelled Ji She and replaced him with Fan Gaoxi.

sentences.zh: 荀櫟言於晉侯曰：「君命大臣，始亂者死。

translations.literal: Xun Li spoke to Jin Marquis said: 'Lord commands ministers, start rebellion ones die.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Li spoke to the Marquis of Jin, saying, 'My lord commands that ministers who start rebellions die.'

sentences.zh: 今三臣始亂而獨逐鞅，用刑不均，請皆逐之。」

translations.literal: Now three ministers started rebellion but alone expel Yang, use punishment not equal, please all expel them.'
translations.idiomatic: Now three ministers started the rebellion, but only Yang was expelled. The punishments are unequal. Please expel them all.'

sentences.zh: 十一月，荀櫟、韓不佞、魏哆奉公命以伐范、中行氏，不克。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Xun Li, Han Bu Ning, Wei Duo received duke command to attack Fan, Zhong Xing clan, not conquer.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Xun Li, Han Bu Ning, and Wei Duo, following the duke's command, attacked the Fan and Zhongxing clans but did not succeed.

sentences.zh: 范、中行氏反伐公，公擊之，范、中行敗走。

translations.literal: Fan, Zhong Xing clan counter attacked duke, duke struck them, Fan, Zhong Xing defeated fled.
translations.idiomatic: The Fan and Zhongxing clans counterattacked the duke. The duke struck at them, and the Fan and Zhongxing clans were defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 丁未，二子奔朝歌。

translations.literal: Ding Wei, two sons fled Zhao Ge.
translations.idiomatic: On Ding Wei, the two sons fled to Zhao Ge.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏以趙氏為請。

translations.literal: Han, Wei with Zhao clan as request.
translations.idiomatic: Han and Wei interceded on behalf of the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 十二月辛未，趙鞅入絳，盟于公宮。

translations.literal: Twelfth month Xin Wei, Zhao Yang entered Jiang, allied at duke palace.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month on Xin Wei, Zhao Yang entered Jiang and formed an alliance in the duke's palace.

sentences.zh: 其明年，知伯文子謂趙鞅曰：「范、中行雖信為亂，安于發之，是安于與謀也。

translations.literal: Its next year, Zhi Bo Wen Zi told Zhao Yang said: 'Fan, Zhong Xing though truly made rebellion, An Yu revealed it, this is An Yu with planned also.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, Zhi Bo Wenzi told Zhao Yang, 'Although the Fan and Zhongxing clans truly rebelled, An Yu revealed it. This means An Yu was in on the plot.'

sentences.zh: 晉國有法，始亂者死。

translations.literal: Jin state has law, start rebellion ones die.
translations.idiomatic: Jin has a law: those who start rebellions die.

sentences.zh: 夫二子已伏罪而安于獨在。」

translations.literal: Indeed two sons already submitted to punishment but An Yu alone remains.'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the two sons have already submitted to punishment, but An Yu alone remains.'

sentences.zh: 趙鞅患之。

translations.literal: Zhao Yang worried it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang was worried about this.

sentences.zh: 安于曰：「臣死，趙氏定，晉國寧，吾死晚矣。」

translations.literal: An Yu said: 'Minister dies, Zhao clan settles, Jin state pacifies, my death late already.'
translations.idiomatic: An Yu said, 'If I die, the Zhao clan will be settled and Jin will be pacified. My death comes too late.'

sentences.zh: 遂自殺。

translations.literal: Then committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: He then committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 趙氏以告知伯，然後趙氏寧。

translations.literal: Zhao clan with told Zhi Bo, then Zhao clan pacified.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao clan informed Zhi Bo, and then the Zhao clan was pacified.

sentences.zh: 孔子聞趙簡子不請晉君而執邯鄲午，保晉陽，故書春秋曰「趙鞅以晉陽畔」。

translations.literal: Kong Zi heard Zhao Jian Zi not requested Jin lord but executed Han Dan Wu, guarded Jin Yang, therefore wrote Chun Qiu said 'Zhao Yang with Jin Yang rebelled'.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi heard that Zhao Jianzi executed Han Dan Wu without requesting the Jin lord's permission, and defended Jinyang. Therefore he wrote in the Chun Qiu: 'Zhao Yang rebelled with Jinyang.'

sentences.zh: 趙簡子有臣曰周舍，好直諫。

translations.literal: Zhao Jian Zi had minister called Zhou She, liked direct remonstrance.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Jianzi had a minister named Zhou She, who liked to remonstrate directly.

sentences.zh: 周舍死，簡子每聽朝，常不悅，大夫請罪。

translations.literal: Zhou She died, Jian Zi every listened court, often not pleased, grand masters requested punishment.
translations.idiomatic: After Zhou She died, Jianzi was often displeased whenever he listened to court. The grand masters requested punishment.

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「大夫無罪。

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Grand masters no crime.
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi said, 'The grand masters have no crime.'

sentences.zh: 吾聞千羊之皮不如一狐之腋。

translations.literal: I heard thousand sheep's skins not equal one fox's armpit.
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that a thousand sheep skins are not equal to one fox's armpit.

sentences.zh: 諸大夫朝，徒聞唯唯，不聞周捨之鄂鄂，是以憂也。」

translations.literal: Various grand masters court, only heard wei wei, not heard Zhou She 's e e, this is why worried also.'
translations.idiomatic: The grand masters at court only say 'yes, yes,' but I don't hear Zhou She's strong opinions. This is why I am worried.'

sentences.zh: 簡子由此能附趙邑而懷晉人。

translations.literal: Jian Zi from this could attach Zhao cities and embrace Jin people.
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi was thereby able to attach the Zhao cities and win over the Jin people.

sentences.zh: 晉定公十八年，趙簡子圍范、中行于朝歌，中行文子奔邯鄲。

translations.literal: Jin Ding Gong eighteenth year, Zhao Jian Zi besieged Fan, Zhong Xing at Zhao Ge, Zhong Xing Wen Zi fled Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year of Duke Ding of Jin, Zhao Jianzi besieged the Fan and Zhongxing clans at Zhao Ge. Zhong Xing Wenzi fled to Handan.

sentences.zh: 明年，衛靈公卒。

translations.literal: Next year, Wei Ling Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, Duke Ling of Wei died.

sentences.zh: 簡子與陽虎送衛太子蒯聵于衛，衛不內，居戚。

translations.literal: Jian Zi with Yang Hu sent Wei crown prince Kuai Kui to Wei, Wei not admitted, resided Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi and Yang Hu escorted Crown Prince Kuai Kui of Wei to Wei. Wei would not admit him, so he resided at Qi.

sentences.zh: 晉定公二十一年，簡子拔邯鄲，中行文子奔柏人。

translations.literal: Jin Ding Gong twenty-first year, Jian Zi captured Han Dan, Zhong Xing Wen Zi fled Bo Ren.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year of Duke Ding of Jin, Jianzi captured Handan. Zhong Xing Wenzi fled to Bo Ren.

sentences.zh: 簡子又圍柏人，中行文子、范昭子遂奔齊。

translations.literal: Jian Zi again besieged Bo Ren, Zhong Xing Wen Zi, Fan Zhao Zi then fled Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jianzi again besieged Bo Ren. Zhong Xing Wenzi and Fan Zhaozi then fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 趙竟有邯鄲、柏人。

translations.literal: Zhao finally had Han Dan, Bo Ren.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao finally possessed Handan and Bo Ren.

sentences.zh: 范、中行餘邑入于晉。

translations.literal: Fan, Zhong Xing remaining cities entered Jin.
translations.idiomatic: The remaining cities of the Fan and Zhongxing clans were incorporated into Jin.

sentences.zh: 趙名晉卿，實專晉權，奉邑侔於諸侯。

translations.literal: Zhao nominally Jin minister, actually monopolized Jin power, fief cities equal to feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao was nominally a minister of Jin, but actually monopolized Jin's power. His fief cities equaled those of the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 晉定公三十年，定公與吳王夫差爭長於黃池，趙簡子從晉定公，卒長吳。

translations.literal: Jin Ding Gong thirtieth year, Ding Gong with Wu King Fu Chai contended precedence at Huang Chi, Zhao Jian Zi followed Jin Ding Gong, finally preceded Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year of Duke Ding of Jin, Duke Ding contended for precedence with King Fu Chai of Wu at Huang Chi. Zhao Jianzi followed Duke Ding of Jin, and finally took precedence over Wu.

sentences.zh: 定公三十七年卒，而簡子除三年之喪，期而已。

translations.literal: Ding Gong thirty-seventh year died, and Jian Zi removed three years' mourning, one year only.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ding died in his thirty-seventh year. Jianzi observed only one year of mourning instead of three.

sentences.zh: 是歲，越王句踐滅吳。

translations.literal: This year, Yue King Gou Jian extinguished Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, King Gou Jian of Yue extinguished Wu.

sentences.zh: 晉出公十一年，知伯伐鄭。

translations.literal: Jin Chu Gong eleventh year, Zhi Bo attacked Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year of Duke Chu of Jin, Zhi Bo attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 趙簡子疾，使太子毋卹將而圍鄭。

translations.literal: Zhao Jian Zi ill, sent crown prince Wu Xu led and besieged Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Jianzi was ill. He sent Crown Prince Wu Xu to lead troops and besiege Zheng.

sentences.zh: 知伯醉，以酒灌擊毋卹。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo drunk, with wine poured struck Wu Xu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo was drunk. He poured wine on Wu Xu and struck him.

sentences.zh: 毋卹群臣請死之。

translations.literal: Wu Xu's various ministers requested to die for him.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Xu's ministers requested to die for him.

sentences.zh: 毋卹曰：「君所以置毋卹，為能忍。」

translations.literal: Wu Xu said: 'Lord so placed Wu Xu, for able to endure.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Xu said, 'My lord placed me here because I can endure.'

sentences.zh: 然亦慍知伯。

translations.literal: Yet also resented Zhi Bo.
translations.idiomatic: Yet he also resented Zhi Bo.

sentences.zh: 知伯歸，因謂簡子，使廢毋卹，簡子不聽。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo returned, therefore told Jian Zi, made abolish Wu Xu, Jian Zi not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo returned and therefore told Jianzi to abolish Wu Xu. Jianzi would not listen.

sentences.zh: 毋卹由此怨知伯。

translations.literal: Wu Xu from this resented Zhi Bo.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Xu resented Zhi Bo from this point on.

sentences.zh: 晉出公十七年，簡子卒，太子毋卹代立，是為襄子。

translations.literal: Jin Chu Gong seventeenth year, Jian Zi died, crown prince Wu Xu succeeded stood, this was Xiang Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year of Duke Chu of Jin, Jianzi died. Crown Prince Wu Xu succeeded him and stood as ruler. This was Xiangzi.

sentences.zh: 趙襄子元年，越圍吳。

translations.literal: Zhao Xiang Zi first year, Yue besieged Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Xiangzi of Zhao, Yue besieged Wu.

sentences.zh: 襄子降喪食，使楚隆問吳王。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi lowered mourning food, sent Chu Long inquired Wu King.
translations.idiomatic: Xiangzi lowered his mourning diet and sent Chu Long to inquire after the King of Wu.

sentences.zh: 襄子姊前為代王夫人。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi sister previously was Dai King wife.
translations.idiomatic: Xiangzi's sister had previously been the wife of the King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 簡子既葬，未除服，北登夏屋，請代王。

translations.literal: Jian Zi already buried, not yet removed mourning, north ascended Xia Wu, invited Dai King.
translations.idiomatic: After Jianzi was buried but before mourning was removed, Xiangzi ascended the Xia Wu tower to the north and invited the King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 使廚人操銅枓以食代王及從者，行斟，陰令宰人各以枓擊殺代王及從官，遂興兵平代地。

translations.literal: Sent cook grasped bronze dagger to feed Dai King and followers, when pouring wine, secretly commanded butchers each with dagger struck killed Dai King and following officials, then raised troops pacified Dai territory.
translations.idiomatic: He sent a cook holding a bronze dagger to serve food to the King of Dai and his followers. While pouring wine, he secretly commanded the butchers to each strike and kill the King of Dai and his following officials with their daggers. Then he raised troops to pacify Dai territory.

sentences.zh: 其姊聞之，泣而呼天，摩笄自殺。

translations.literal: His sister heard it, wept and called heaven, rubbed hairpin committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: When his sister heard of it, she wept and called to heaven, rubbed her hairpin, and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 代人憐之，所死地名之為摩笄之山。

translations.literal: Dai people pitied her, place died named it Mo Ji mountain.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Dai pitied her. The place where she died was named Mo Ji Mountain.

sentences.zh: 遂以代封伯魯子周為代成君。

translations.literal: Then with Dai enfeoffed Bo Lu son Zhou as Dai Cheng Jun.
translations.idiomatic: He then enfeoffed Bo Lu's son Zhou with Dai territory, making him Dai Cheng Jun.

sentences.zh: 伯魯者，襄子兄，故太子。

translations.literal: Bo Lu ones, Xiang Zi elder brother, former crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Bo Lu was Xiangzi's elder brother and former crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子蚤死，故封其子。

translations.literal: Crown prince early died, therefore enfeoffed his son.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince died early, so he enfeoffed his son.

sentences.zh: 襄子立四年，知伯與趙、韓、魏盡分其范、中行故地。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi established four years, Zhi Bo with Zhao, Han, Wei completely divided their Fan, Zhong Xing former territories.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Xiangzi's rule, Zhi Bo, along with Zhao, Han, and Wei, completely divided up the former territories of Fan and Zhongxing.

sentences.zh: 晉出公怒，告齊、魯，欲以伐四卿。

translations.literal: Jin Chu Gong angry, told Qi, Lu, wished to attack four ministers.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Chu of Jin was angry. He informed Qi and Lu, wishing to attack the four ministers.

sentences.zh: 四卿恐，遂共攻出公。

translations.literal: Four ministers feared, then together attacked Chu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The four ministers were afraid, so they jointly attacked Duke Chu.

sentences.zh: 出公奔齊，道死。

translations.literal: Chu Gong fled Qi, on road died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Chu fled to Qi and died en route.

sentences.zh: 知伯乃立昭公曾孫驕，是為晉懿公。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo then established Zhao Gong great-grandson Jiao, this was Jin Yi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo then established Duke Zhao's great-grandson Jiao as ruler. This was Duke Yi of Jin.

sentences.zh: 知伯益驕。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo increasingly arrogant.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo grew increasingly arrogant.

sentences.zh: 請地韓、魏，韓、魏與之。

translations.literal: Requested territory Han, Wei, Han, Wei gave it.
translations.idiomatic: He requested territory from Han and Wei, and Han and Wei gave it to him.

sentences.zh: 請地趙，趙不與，以其圍鄭之辱。

translations.literal: Requested territory Zhao, Zhao not gave, because besieging Zheng humiliation.
translations.idiomatic: He requested territory from Zhao, but Zhao would not give it, because of the humiliation from the Zheng siege.

sentences.zh: 知伯怒，遂率韓、魏攻趙。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo angry, then led Han, Wei attacked Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo became angry and then led Han and Wei to attack Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙襄子懼，乃奔保晉陽。

translations.literal: Zhao Xiang Zi feared, then fled defended Jin Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Xiangzi was afraid and fled to defend Jinyang.

sentences.zh: 原過從，後，至於王澤，見三人，自帶以上可見，自帶以下不可見。

translations.literal: Yuan Guo followed, afterward, arrived at Wang Ze, saw three persons, from belt above visible, from belt below invisible.
translations.idiomatic: Yuan Guo followed. Later, when they arrived at Wang Ze, he saw three persons. From the belt upward they were visible, but from the belt downward they were invisible.

sentences.zh: 與原過竹二節，莫通。

translations.literal: Gave Yuan Guo bamboo two joints, not opened.
translations.idiomatic: They gave Yuan Guo two bamboo joints, but he could not open them.

sentences.zh: 曰：「為我以是遺趙毋卹。」

translations.literal: Said: 'For me with this send Zhao Wu Xu.'
translations.idiomatic: They said, 'Send this to Zhao Wu Xu for me.'

sentences.zh: 原過既至，以告襄子。

translations.literal: Yuan Guo already arrived, with told Xiang Zi.
translations.idiomatic: When Yuan Guo arrived, he told Xiangzi.

sentences.zh: 襄子齊三日，親自剖竹，有朱書曰：「趙毋卹，余霍泰山山陽侯天使也。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi purified three days, personally split bamboo, had vermilion writing said: 'Zhao Wu Xu, I Huo Tai Shan Shan Yang Hou heavenly envoy also.
translations.idiomatic: Xiangzi purified himself for three days and personally split the bamboo. There was vermilion writing that said, 'Zhao Wu Xu, I am the heavenly envoy of Huo Tai Shan Shan Yang Hou.'

sentences.zh: 三月丙戌，余將使女反滅知氏。

translations.literal: Third month Bing Xu, I will make you counter extinguish Zhi clan.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bing Xu day of the third month, I will make you counterattack and extinguish the Zhi clan.'

sentences.zh: 女亦立我百邑，余將賜女林胡之地。

translations.literal: You also establish me hundred cities, I will grant you Lin Hu territory.
translations.idiomatic: You must also establish a hundred cities for me. I will grant you the territory of the Lin Hu.'

sentences.zh: 至于後世，且有伉王，赤黑，龍面而鳥噣，鬢麋髭髯，大膺大胸，修下而馮，左袵界乘，奄有河宗，至于休溷諸貉，南伐晉別，北滅黑姑。」

translations.literal: Reach later generations, moreover will have strong king, red black, dragon face and bird beak, temple deer beard whiskers, big breast big chest, long below and bent, left lapel boundary ride, suddenly have river ancestor, reach Xiu Zhuo various barbarian, south attack Jin branch, north extinguish black aunt.'
translations.idiomatic: In later generations, there will be a strong king, red and black in color, with a dragon's face and a bird's beak, deer-like temples and whiskers, a large breast and chest, long legs but bent, wearing left-lapelled robes and riding in a chariot. He will suddenly possess the River Ancestor, reaching to the Xiu Zhuo barbarians. He will attack the Jin branch to the south and extinguish the black aunt to the north.'

sentences.zh: 襄子再拜，受三神之令。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi bowed twice, received three spirits command.
translations.idiomatic: Xiangzi bowed twice and received the command of the three spirits.

sentences.zh: 三國攻晉陽，歲餘，引汾水灌其城，城不浸者三版。

translations.literal: Three states attacked Jin Yang, year remaining, led Fen water flooded its city, city not soaked three boards.
translations.idiomatic: The three states attacked Jinyang. After more than a year, they diverted the Fen River to flood the city. The city was not submerged by three boards.

sentences.zh: 城中懸釜而炊，易子而食。

translations.literal: City in suspended cauldron and cooked, exchanged children and ate.
translations.idiomatic: In the city, they suspended cauldrons to cook and exchanged children to eat.

sentences.zh: 群臣皆有外心，禮益慢，唯高共不敢失禮。

translations.literal: Various ministers all had outer hearts, ritual increasingly slow, only Gao Gong not dared lose ritual.
translations.idiomatic: All the ministers had disloyal hearts. The rituals became increasingly lax. Only Gao Gong dared not lose proper ritual.

sentences.zh: 襄子懼，乃夜使相張孟同私於韓、魏。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi feared, then night sent prime minister Zhang Meng Tong secretly to Han, Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Xiangzi was afraid, so he secretly sent the prime minister Zhang Meng Tong to Han and Wei at night.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏與合謀，以三月丙戌，三國反滅知氏，共分其地。

translations.literal: Han, Wei with united plotted, with third month Bing Xu, three states counter extinguished Zhi clan, together divided its territory.
translations.idiomatic: Han and Wei united with him in plotting. On the Bing Xu day of the third month, the three states counterattacked and extinguished the Zhi clan, together dividing its territory.

sentences.zh: 於是襄子行賞，高共為上。

translations.literal: Thereupon Xiang Zi carried out rewards, Gao Gong as highest.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Xiangzi distributed rewards, with Gao Gong receiving the highest.

sentences.zh: 張孟同曰：「晉陽之難，唯共無功。」

translations.literal: Zhang Meng Tong said: 'Jin Yang difficulty, only Gong no merit.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Meng Tong said, 'During the Jinyang crisis, only Gong had no merit.'

sentences.zh: 襄子曰：「方晉陽急，群臣皆懈，惟共不敢失人臣禮，是以先之。」

translations.literal: Xiang Zi said: 'When Jin Yang urgent, various ministers all lax, only Gong not dared lose minister ritual, this is why first him.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiangzi said, 'When Jinyang was in crisis, all the ministers were lax. Only Gong dared not lose the ritual of a minister. This is why I put him first.'

sentences.zh: 於是趙北有代，南并知氏，彊於韓、魏。

translations.literal: Thereupon Zhao north had Dai, south annexed Zhi clan, strong over Han, Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Zhao possessed Dai to the north and annexed the Zhi clan to the south. It was stronger than Han and Wei.

sentences.zh: 遂祠三神於百邑，使原過主霍泰山祠祀。

translations.literal: Then sacrificed to three spirits at hundred cities, sent Yuan Guo presided Huo Tai Shan sacrificial rites.
translations.idiomatic: He then sacrificed to the three spirits at a hundred cities and sent Yuan Guo to preside over the sacrificial rites at Huo Tai Shan.

sentences.zh: 其後娶空同氏，生五子。

translations.literal: His later married Kong Tong clan, begat five sons.
translations.idiomatic: Later he married a woman from the Kong Tong clan and begat five sons.

sentences.zh: 襄子為伯魯之不立也，不肯立子，且必欲傳位與伯魯子代成君。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi because Bo Lu not established, not willing establish son, moreover must wished transmit position to Bo Lu son Dai Cheng Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Because Bo Lu had not been established as heir, Xiangzi was unwilling to establish his own son, and he certainly wished to transmit the position to Bo Lu's son, Dai Cheng Jun.

sentences.zh: 成君先死，乃取代成君子浣立為太子。

translations.literal: Cheng Jun first died, then took Dai Cheng Jun son Huan established as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Jun died first, so he took Cheng Jun's son Huan and established him as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 襄子立三十三年卒，浣立，是為獻侯。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi established thirty-three years died, Huan established, this was Xian Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Xiangzi ruled for thirty-three years and died. Huan was established as ruler. This was Xian Hou.

sentences.zh: 獻侯少即位，治中牟。

translations.literal: Xian Hou young ascended throne, governed Zhong Mou.
translations.idiomatic: Xian Hou ascended the throne young and governed Zhong Mou.

sentences.zh: 襄子弟桓子逐獻侯，自立於代，一年卒。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi younger brother Jian Zi expelled Xian Hou, self-established at Dai, one year died.
translations.idiomatic: Xiangzi's younger brother Jian Zi expelled Xian Hou and established himself at Dai. He died after one year.

sentences.zh: 國人曰桓子立非襄子意，乃共殺其子而復迎立獻侯。

translations.literal: State people said Jian Zi establishment not Xiang Zi intent, then together killed his son and again welcomed established Xian Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The people of the state said that Jian Zi's establishment was not Xiangzi's intent, so they together killed his son and again welcomed and established Xian Hou.

sentences.zh: 十年，中山武公初立。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Zhong Shan Wu Gong first established.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Zhong Shan Wu Gong was first established as ruler.

sentences.zh: 十三年，城平邑。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, walled Ping Yi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, they built city walls at Ping Yi.

sentences.zh: 十五年，獻侯卒，子烈侯籍立。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Xian Hou died, son Lie Hou Ji established.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Xian Hou died. His son Lie Hou Ji was established as ruler.

sentences.zh: 烈侯元年，魏文侯伐中山，使太子擊守之。

translations.literal: Lie Hou first year, Wei Wen Hou attacked Zhong Shan, sent crown prince Ji guarded it.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Lie Hou, Wei Wen Hou attacked Zhong Shan and sent Crown Prince Ji to guard it.

sentences.zh: 六年，魏、韓、趙皆相立為諸侯，追尊獻子為獻侯。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Wei, Han, Zhao all mutually established as feudal lords, posthumously honored Xian Zi as Xian Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Wei, Han, and Zhao all mutually established each other as feudal lords and posthumously honored Xian Zi as Xian Hou.

sentences.zh: 烈侯好音，謂相國公仲連曰：「寡人有愛，可以貴之乎？」

translations.literal: Lie Hou liked music, told prime minister Gong Zhong Lian said: 'I have love, can ennoble it huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Lie Hou liked music. He told the prime minister Gong Zhong Lian, 'I have a favorite. Can I ennoble him?'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「富之可，貴之則否。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Enrich him can, ennoble him then no.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said, 'You can enrich him, but ennobling him would not be good.'

sentences.zh: 烈侯曰：「然。

translations.literal: Lie Hou said: 'Yes.
translations.idiomatic: Lie Hou said, 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 夫鄭歌者槍、石二人，吾賜之田，人萬畝。」

translations.literal: Indeed Zheng singers Qiang, Shi two persons, I grant them fields, each ten thousand mu.'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the Zheng singers Qiang and Shi, two persons. I will grant them fields, ten thousand mu each.'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said, 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 不與。

translations.literal: Not gave.
translations.idiomatic: He did not give it.

sentences.zh: 居一月，烈侯從代來，問歌者田。

translations.literal: Resided one month, Lie Hou from Dai came, asked singers fields.
translations.idiomatic: After one month, Lie Hou came from Dai and asked about the singers' fields.

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「求，未有可者。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Sought, not yet had suitable ones.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said, 'I sought them, but there were none suitable.'

sentences.zh: 有頃，烈侯復問。

translations.literal: After a while, Lie Hou again asked.
translations.idiomatic: After a while, Lie Hou asked again.

sentences.zh: 公仲終不與，乃稱疾不朝。

translations.literal: Gong Zhong in end not gave, then claimed illness not court.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong finally refused. He claimed illness and did not attend court.

sentences.zh: 番吾君自代來，謂公仲曰：「君實好善，而未知所持。

translations.literal: Fan Wu jun from Dai came, told Gong Zhong said: 'Lord indeed likes good, but not knows what to hold.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Fan Wu came from Dai and told Gong Zhong, 'You indeed love goodness, but you do not know what to hold to.'

sentences.zh: 今公仲相趙，於今四年，亦有進士乎？」

translations.literal: Now Gong Zhong prime ministers Zhao, to now four years, also has advanced scholars huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Now Gong Zhong has been prime minister of Zhao for four years. Have you also advanced any scholars?'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「未也。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Not yet.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said, 'Not yet.'

sentences.zh: 番吾君曰：「牛畜、荀欣、徐越皆可。」

translations.literal: Fan Wu jun said: 'Niu Xu, Xun Xin, Xu Yue all can.'
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Fan Wu said, 'Niu Xu, Xun Xin, and Xu Yue are all suitable.'

sentences.zh: 公仲乃進三人。

translations.literal: Gong Zhong then advanced three persons.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong then advanced the three men.

sentences.zh: 及朝，烈侯復問：「歌者田何如？」

translations.literal: Reached court, Lie Hou again asked: 'Singers fields what like?'
translations.idiomatic: When they reached court, Lie Hou again asked, 'What about the singers' fields?'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「方使擇其善者。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Just sent to select their good ones.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said, 'I have just sent people to select the good ones.'

sentences.zh: 牛畜侍烈侯以仁義，約以王道，烈侯逌然。

translations.literal: Niu Xu served Lie Hou with benevolence righteousness, constrained with kingly way, Lie Hou enlightened.
translations.idiomatic: Niu Xu served Lie Hou with benevolence and righteousness, constrained him with the kingly way, and Lie Hou was enlightened.

sentences.zh: 明日，荀欣侍，以選練舉賢，任官使能。

translations.literal: Next day, Xun Xin served, with selecting training raising worthy, appointing officials employing able.
translations.idiomatic: The next day, Xun Xin served, selecting and training to raise the worthy, appointing officials and employing the able.

sentences.zh: 明日，徐越侍，以節財儉用，察度功德。

translations.literal: Next day, Xu Yue served, with regulating wealth frugal use, examining measuring merit virtue.
translations.idiomatic: The next day, Xu Yue served, regulating wealth and using frugality, examining and measuring merit and virtue.

sentences.zh: 所與無不充，君說。

translations.literal: What given nothing not full, lord pleased.
translations.idiomatic: What was given was all sufficient. The lord was pleased.

sentences.zh: 烈侯使使謂相國曰：「歌者之田且止。」

translations.literal: Lie Hou sent messenger told prime minister said: 'Singers fields moreover stop.'
translations.idiomatic: Lie Hou sent a messenger to tell the prime minister, 'The singers' fields should be stopped for now.'

sentences.zh: 官牛畜為師，荀欣為中尉，徐越為內史，賜相國衣二襲。

translations.literal: Appointed Niu Xu as teacher, Xun Xin as central captain, Xu Yue as inner scribe, granted prime minister clothes two sets.
translations.idiomatic: He appointed Niu Xu as teacher, Xun Xin as central captain, Xu Yue as inner scribe, and granted the prime minister two sets of clothes.

sentences.zh: 九年，烈侯卒，弟武公立。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Lie Hou died, younger brother Wu Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Lie Hou died. His younger brother Wu Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 武公十三年卒，趙復立烈侯太子章，是為敬侯。

translations.literal: Wu Gong thirteenth year died, Zhao again established Lie Hou crown prince Zhang, this was Jing Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Gong died in the thirteenth year. Zhao again established Lie Hou's crown prince Zhang. This was Jing Hou.

sentences.zh: 是歲，魏文侯卒。

translations.literal: This year, Wei Wen Hou died.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, Wei Wen Hou died.

sentences.zh: 敬侯元年，武公子朝作亂，不克，出奔魏。

translations.literal: Jing Hou first year, Wu Gong son Zi Chao made rebellion, not conquer, out fled Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Jing Hou, Wu Gong's son Zi Chao made rebellion but did not succeed. He fled to Wei.

sentences.zh: 趙始都邯鄲。

translations.literal: Zhao began capital Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao began to make Handan its capital.

sentences.zh: 二年，敗齊于靈丘。

translations.literal: Second year, defeated Qi at Ling Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, they defeated Qi at Ling Qiu.

sentences.zh: 三年，救魏于廩丘，大敗齊人。

translations.literal: Third year, rescued Wei at Dian Qiu, greatly defeated Qi people.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, they rescued Wei at Dian Qiu and greatly defeated the Qi people.

sentences.zh: 四年，魏敗我兔臺。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Wei defeated us Tu Tai.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Wei defeated us at Tu Tai.

sentences.zh: 筑剛平以侵衛。

translations.literal: Built Gang Ping to invade Wei.
translations.idiomatic: They built Gang Ping in order to invade Wei.

sentences.zh: 五年，齊、魏為衛攻趙，取我剛平。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Qi, Wei for Wei attacked Zhao, took our Gang Ping.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Qi and Wei attacked Zhao on behalf of Wei and took our Gang Ping.

sentences.zh: 六年，借兵於楚伐魏，取棘蒲。

translations.literal: Sixth year, borrowed troops from Chu attacked Wei, took Ji Pu.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, they borrowed troops from Chu to attack Wei and took Ji Pu.

sentences.zh: 八年，拔魏黃城。

translations.literal: Eighth year, captured Wei Huang Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, they captured Wei's Huang Cheng.

sentences.zh: 九年，伐齊。

translations.literal: Ninth year, attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, they attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊伐燕，趙救燕。

translations.literal: Qi attacked Yan, Zhao rescued Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Qi attacked Yan, and Zhao rescued Yan.

sentences.zh: 十年，與中山戰于房子。

translations.literal: Tenth year, with Zhong Shan battled at Fang Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, they battled with Zhong Shan at Fang Zi.

sentences.zh: 十一年，魏、韓、趙共滅晉，分其地。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Wei, Han, Zhao together extinguished Jin, divided its territory.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Wei, Han, and Zhao together extinguished Jin and divided its territory.

sentences.zh: 伐中山，又戰於中人。

translations.literal: Attacked Zhong Shan, again battled at Zhong Ren.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Zhong Shan and again battled at Zhong Ren.

sentences.zh: 十二年，敬侯卒，子成侯種立。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Jing Hou died, son Cheng Hou Zhong established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Jing Hou died. His son Cheng Hou Zhong was established.

sentences.zh: 成侯元年，公子勝與成侯爭立，為亂。

translations.literal: Cheng Hou first year, Gong Zi Sheng with Cheng Hou contended establishment, made rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Cheng Hou, Gong Zi Sheng contended with Cheng Hou for the position and made rebellion.

sentences.zh: 二年六月，雨雪。

translations.literal: Second year sixth month, rained snow.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month of the second year, it snowed.

sentences.zh: 三年，太戊午為相。

translations.literal: Third year, Tai Wu Wu became prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Tai Wu Wu became prime minister.

sentences.zh: 伐衛，取鄉邑七十三。

translations.literal: Attacked Wei, took district cities seventy-three.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Wei and took seventy-three district cities.

sentences.zh: 魏敗我藺。

translations.literal: Wei defeated us Lin.
translations.idiomatic: Wei defeated us at Lin.

sentences.zh: 四年，與秦戰高安，敗之。

translations.literal: Fourth year, with Qin battled Gao An, defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, they battled with Qin at Gao An and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 五年，伐齊于鄄。

translations.literal: Fifth year, attacked Qi at Juan.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, they attacked Qi at Juan.

sentences.zh: 魏敗我懷。

translations.literal: Wei defeated us Huai.
translations.idiomatic: Wei defeated us at Huai.

sentences.zh: 攻鄭，敗之，以與韓，韓與我長子。

translations.literal: Attacked Zheng, defeated it, with gave to Han, Han gave me eldest son.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Zheng and defeated it. They gave it to Han, and Han gave them their eldest son.

sentences.zh: 六年，中山筑長城。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Zhong Shan built long wall.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Zhong Shan built a long wall.

sentences.zh: 伐魏，敗湪澤，圍魏惠王。

translations.literal: Attacked Wei, defeated at Tuo Ze, besieged Wei Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Wei, defeated them at Tuo Ze, and besieged King Hui of Wei.

sentences.zh: 七年，侵齊，至長城。

translations.literal: Seventh year, invaded Qi, reached long wall.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, they invaded Qi and reached the long wall.

sentences.zh: 與韓攻周。

translations.literal: With Han attacked Zhou.

translations.literal: He had Zhou Fen dress in barbarian clothing to tutor Prince He.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered Zhou Fen to wear barbarian attire while tutoring Prince He.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，復攻中山，攘地北至燕、代，西至雲中、九原。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, he again attacked Zhongshan, expanding territory north to Yan and Dai, west to Yunzhong and Jiuyuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, he attacked Zhongshan again, extending Zhao's borders north to Yan and Dai, west to Yunzhong and Jiuyuan.

sentences.zh: 二十七年五月戊申，大朝於東宮，傳國，立王子何以為王。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, fifth month, wushen day, he held a great court at the Eastern Palace, transmitted the state, and established Prince He as king.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, on the wushen day of the fifth month, he held a grand court assembly in the Eastern Palace, ceded the throne, and installed Prince He as king.

sentences.zh: 王廟見禮畢，出臨朝。

translations.literal: After the king performed the ancestral temple rites, he emerged to hold court.
translations.idiomatic: After completing the rites at the ancestral temple, the king emerged to hold audience.

sentences.zh: 大夫悉為臣，肥義為相國，并傅王。

translations.literal: All the grandees became ministers, Fei Yi became chancellor and also tutored the king.
translations.idiomatic: All the grandees became his ministers, Fei Yi was appointed chancellor and also served as the king's tutor.

sentences.zh: 是為惠文王。

translations.literal: This was King Huiwen.
translations.idiomatic: He became known as King Huiwen.

sentences.zh: 惠文王，惠后吳娃子也。

translations.literal: King Huiwen was the son of Empress Hui, a Wu woman.
translations.idiomatic: King Huiwen was Empress Hui's son by a woman from Wu.

sentences.zh: 武靈王自號為主父。

translations.literal: King Wuling styled himself as Lord Father.
translations.idiomatic: King Wuling took the title 'Lord Father' for himself.

sentences.zh: 主父欲令子主治國，而身胡服將士大夫西北略胡地，而欲從雲中、九原直南襲秦，於是詐自為使者入秦。

translations.literal: Lord Father wished to have his son govern the state while he himself, dressed in barbarian clothing, led the grandees northwest to conquer barbarian lands, and planned to go south directly from Yunzhong and Jiuyuan to attack Qin, thus he disguised himself as an envoy and entered Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Father wished his son to govern the state while he himself, clad in barbarian attire, led the nobles northwest to conquer barbarian territories, intending to strike south directly from Yunzhong and Jiuyuan to attack Qin. Thus he disguised himself as an envoy and infiltrated Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦昭王不知，已而怪其狀甚偉，非人臣之度，使人逐之，而主父馳已脫關矣。

translations.literal: King Zhao of Qin did not recognize him, but soon found his demeanor exceedingly noble, not that of a subject, and sent people to pursue him, but Lord Father had already galloped away and escaped the pass.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao of Qin did not recognize him at first, but soon noted his extraordinarily dignified bearing, quite unlike that of a mere subject. He sent men to pursue him, but Lord Father had already galloped away and escaped through the pass.

sentences.zh: 審問之，乃主父也。

translations.literal: When they carefully inquired, it was Lord Father.
translations.idiomatic: Upon thorough investigation, they discovered it was Lord Father.

sentences.zh: 秦人大驚。

translations.literal: The people of Qin were greatly astonished.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin court was stunned.

sentences.zh: 主父所以入秦者，欲自略地形，因觀秦王之為人也。

translations.literal: The reason Lord Father entered Qin was to personally survey the terrain and observe the character of the King of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Father's purpose in entering Qin was to personally reconnoiter the terrain and assess King Zhao's character.

sentences.zh: 惠文王二年，主父行新地，遂出代，西遇樓煩王於西河而致其兵。

translations.literal: In the second year of King Huiwen, Lord Father toured the new territories, then left Dai, met the king of Loufan west at the Xi River and obtained his troops.
translations.idiomatic: In King Huiwen's second year, Lord Father inspected the newly conquered lands, then departed from Dai and encountered the king of Loufan to the west at the Xi River, securing his military support.

sentences.zh: 三年，滅中山，遷其王於膚施。

translations.literal: In the third year, he destroyed Zhongshan and relocated its king to Fushi.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, he annihilated Zhongshan and exiled its king to Fushi.

sentences.zh: 起靈壽，北地方從，代道大通。

translations.literal: He built Lingshou, the northern territories submitted, the Dai road was greatly opened.
translations.idiomatic: He established Lingshou; the northern territories submitted; the road to Dai was greatly improved.

sentences.zh: 還歸，行賞，大赦，置酒酺五日，封長子章為代安陽君。

translations.literal: Upon returning, he distributed rewards, granted a great amnesty, held drinking feasts for five days, and enfeoffed his eldest son Zhang as Lord of Dai Anyang.
translations.idiomatic: Upon his return, he distributed rewards, declared a general amnesty, held drinking banquets for five days, and enfeoffed his eldest son Zhang as Lord of Dai Anyang.

sentences.zh: 章素侈，心不服其弟所立。

translations.literal: Zhang was habitually extravagant, his heart not accepting that his younger brother was established as king.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang was habitually extravagant and could not accept in his heart that his younger brother had been made king.

sentences.zh: 主父又使田不禮相章也。

translations.literal: Lord Father also sent Tian Buli to be chancellor for Zhang.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Father also appointed Tian Buli as chancellor to Zhang.

sentences.zh: 李兌謂肥義曰：「公子章彊壯而志驕，黨眾而欲大，殆有私乎？

translations.literal: Li Kui said to Fei Yi: 'Prince Zhang is strong and robust but arrogant in ambition, has many partisans and great desires, he likely has private designs?'
translations.idiomatic: Li Kui said to Fei Yi: 'Prince Zhang is strong and vigorous but arrogant in his ambitions, commands many followers and harbors grand designs—does he perhaps have ulterior motives?'

sentences.zh: 田不禮之為人也，忍殺而驕。

translations.literal: Tian Buli's character is tolerant of killing and arrogant.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Buli is a man who tolerates murder and acts with arrogance.

sentences.zh: 二人相得，必有謀陰賊起，一出身徼幸。

translations.literal: The two get along well, there must be dark treacherous plots arising, seeking personal advantage through risky ventures.
translations.idiomatic: The two men are well-matched; dark and treacherous schemes are sure to arise between them, each seeking personal gain through desperate gambles.

sentences.zh: 夫小人有欲，輕慮淺謀，徒見其利而不顧其害，同類相推，俱入禍門。

translations.literal: Indeed, petty men have desires, shallow planning and superficial schemes, only seeing benefits without considering harm, like kinds pushing each other, all entering the gate of calamity.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, petty men are driven by desires, their plans shallow and their schemes superficial. They see only the benefits without considering the harms, pushing each other along like their kind, all stumbling through the gate of disaster.

sentences.zh: 以吾觀之，必不久矣。

translations.literal: From my observation, it will not be long.
translations.idiomatic: In my judgment, disaster cannot be far off.

sentences.zh: 子任重而勢大，亂之所始，禍之所集也，子必先患。

translations.literal: You have heavy responsibilities and great influence, you are where disorder begins, where calamity gathers, you will surely suffer first.
translations.idiomatic: You bear heavy responsibilities and wield great power—you are the source of disorder, the gathering point of calamity. You will surely be the first to suffer.

sentences.zh: 仁者愛萬物而智者備禍於未形，不仁不智，何以為國？

translations.literal: The benevolent love all things while the wise prepare for disaster before it takes shape, if not benevolent and not wise, how can one govern the state?
translations.idiomatic: The benevolent cherish all living things; the wise prepare for disaster before it manifests. Without benevolence or wisdom, how can one govern a state?

sentences.zh: 子奚不稱疾毋出，傳政於公子成？

translations.literal: Why don't you claim illness and not go out, transfer governance to Prince Cheng?
translations.idiomatic: Why not feign illness and withdraw from court, handing over governance to Prince Cheng?

sentences.zh: 毋為怨府，毋為禍梯。」

translations.literal: Do not become a repository of resentment, do not become a ladder for calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: Do not become a storehouse of resentment, nor a ladder for disaster.'

sentences.zh: 肥義曰：「不可，昔者主父以王屬義也，曰：『毋變而度，毋異而慮，堅守一心，以歿而世。』

translations.literal: Fei Yi said: 'It cannot be done. Previously Lord Father entrusted the king to me, saying: "Do not change your standards, do not have different thoughts, firmly hold to one heart, until death and through the ages."'
translations.idiomatic: Fei Yi replied: 'It cannot be done. Lord Father once entrusted the king to my care, saying: "Do not alter your principles, do not harbor divided thoughts, hold steadfast to one purpose, unto death and throughout the ages."'

sentences.zh: 義再拜受命而籍之。

translations.literal: Yi bowed twice, accepted the command, and recorded it.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Yi bowed twice, accepted the charge, and committed it to writing.

sentences.zh: 今畏不禮之難而忘吾籍，變孰大焉。

translations.literal: Now fearing Buli's difficulties and forgetting my record, what change could be greater?
translations.idiomatic: Now, to fear Buli's threats and forget my written pledge—what greater betrayal could there be?

sentences.zh: 進受嚴命，退而不全，負孰甚焉。

translations.literal: Having advanced to receive solemn commands, but retreating without fulfilling them, what betrayal could be greater?
translations.idiomatic: Having stepped forward to accept solemn commands, but retreating without fulfilling them—what greater disloyalty could there be?

sentences.zh: 變負之臣，不容於刑。

translations.literal: A minister who changes and betrays is not tolerated by punishment.
translations.idiomatic: A minister who reneges on his commitments cannot be tolerated, even by the harshest punishments.

sentences.zh: 諺曰『死者復生，生者不愧』。

translations.literal: The proverb says: 'The dead are revived, the living have no regrets.'
translations.idiomatic: As the proverb says: 'The dead are brought back to life, the living have no cause for shame.'

sentences.zh: 吾言已在前矣，吾欲全吾言，安得全吾身！

translations.literal: My words are already spoken before, I wish to fulfill my words, how can I preserve my body!
translations.idiomatic: My words have already been spoken; I wish to honor them completely. How can I preserve my body if I do not?

sentences.zh: 且夫貞臣也難至而節見，忠臣也累至而行明。

translations.literal: Moreover, the steadfast minister shows his integrity when difficulties arrive, the loyal minister clarifies his conduct when troubles accumulate.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the steadfast minister reveals his integrity when hardships come; the loyal minister demonstrates his virtue when troubles multiply.

sentences.zh: 子則有賜而忠我矣，雖然，吾有語在前者也，終不敢失。」

translations.literal: You have already honored me with your counsel and been loyal to me, although, I have words spoken before, I ultimately dare not lose them.'
translations.idiomatic: You have already honored me with your wisdom and shown me loyalty. Nevertheless, I have given my word before, and I dare not ultimately forsake it.'

sentences.zh: 李兌曰：「諾，子勉之矣！

translations.literal: Li Kui said: 'Very well, do your best!'
translations.idiomatic: Li Kui replied: 'Very well, then exert yourself!'

sentences.zh: 吾見子已今年耳。」

translations.literal: 'I will see you again this year.'
translations.idiomatic: 'I will see you again before this year is out.'

sentences.zh: 涕泣而出。

translations.literal: Weeping, he left.
translations.idiomatic: Weeping, he departed.

sentences.zh: 李兌數見公子成，以備田不禮之事。

translations.literal: Li Kui frequently met with Prince Cheng to prepare for Tian Buli's matters.
translations.idiomatic: Li Kui met frequently with Prince Cheng to prepare against Tian Buli's schemes.

sentences.zh: 異日肥義謂信期曰：「公子與田不禮甚可憂也。

translations.literal: Another day Fei Yi said to Xin Qi: 'The prince and Tian Buli are greatly worrisome.'
translations.idiomatic: On another day, Fei Yi said to Xin Qi: 'The prince and Tian Buli are extremely troubling.'

sentences.zh: 其於義也聲善而實惡，此為人也不子不臣。

translations.literal: In regard to righteousness, he has a good reputation but evil reality, this kind of person is neither filial nor a proper minister.
translations.idiomatic: In matters of righteousness, he has a reputation for goodness but a reality of evil. Such a person is neither a proper son nor a proper minister.

sentences.zh: 吾聞之也，姦臣在朝，國之殘也；

translations.literal: I have heard that when treacherous ministers are in court, it is the ruin of the state;
translations.idiomatic: I have heard it said that when treacherous ministers fill the court, it spells ruin for the state;

sentences.zh: 讒臣在中，主之蠹也。

translations.literal: Slanderous ministers in the center are the ruler's parasites.
