translations.idiomatic: Slanderers in the inner circle are parasites gnawing at their ruler.

sentences.zh: 此人貪而欲大，內得主而外為暴。

translations.literal: This person is greedy and desires greatness, internally he gains the master's favor but externally acts tyrannically.
translations.idiomatic: This man is greedy and ambitious, currying favor within while tyrannizing without.

sentences.zh: 矯令為慢，以擅一旦之命，不難為也，禍且逮國。

translations.literal: Falsifying orders to be disrespectful, monopolizing the command of a single day, it is not difficult to do, but calamity will reach the state.
translations.idiomatic: It is no great feat to forge orders and show disrespect, monopolizing power for a single day—but such calamity will engulf the entire state.

sentences.zh: 今吾憂之，夜而忘寐，饑而忘食。

translations.literal: Now I worry about it, at night forgetting sleep, when hungry forgetting food.
translations.idiomatic: Now I worry over it so much that at night I forget to sleep, and when hungry I forget to eat.

sentences.zh: 盜賊出入不可不備。

translations.literal: Thieves and bandits entering and leaving cannot but be guarded against.
translations.idiomatic: We must prepare against bandits and traitors coming and going.

sentences.zh: 自今以來，若有召王者必見吾面，我將先以身當之，無故而王乃入。」

translations.literal: From now on, if anyone summons the king, they must see my face first. I will personally block them; only if there is no treachery may the king enter.'
translations.idiomatic: From this day forward, anyone summoning the king must first face me. I will personally stand in their way; only if there is no treachery may the king enter.'

sentences.zh: 信期曰：「善哉，吾得聞此也！」

translations.literal: Xin Qi said: 'Excellent! I am fortunate to hear this!'
translations.idiomatic: Xin Qi exclaimed: 'Excellent! I am privileged to hear such wisdom!'

sentences.zh: 四年，朝群臣，安陽君亦來朝。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, he held court for the ministers, the Lord of Anyang also came to court.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, he received the ministers at court; the Lord of Anyang also attended.

sentences.zh: 主父令王聽朝，而自從旁觀窺群臣宗室之禮。

translations.literal: Lord Father had the king hold court while he himself observed from the side, examining the ministers and royal family's etiquette.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Father had the king preside over court while he observed from the sidelines, scrutinizing the etiquette of ministers and royal kin.

sentences.zh: 見其長子章傫然也，反北面為臣，詘於其弟，心憐之，於是乃欲分趙而王章於代，計未決而輟。

translations.literal: Seeing his eldest son Zhang standing dejectedly, facing north as a minister, bowing to his younger brother, his heart pitied him, thus he wished to divide Zhao and make Zhang king in Dai, but the plan was undecided and abandoned.
translations.idiomatic: Seeing his eldest son Zhang standing there dejected, facing north as a subject and deferring to his younger brother, Lord Father felt pity in his heart. Thus he considered dividing Zhao and making Zhang king of Dai, but the plan remained unresolved and was set aside.

sentences.zh: 主父及王游沙丘，異宮，公子章即以其徒與田不禮作亂，詐以主父令召王。

translations.literal: Lord Father and the king toured Shaqiu, staying in separate palaces. Prince Zhang immediately with his followers and Tian Buli rebelled, falsely using Lord Father's command to summon the king.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Father and the king traveled to Shaqiu, lodging in separate palaces. Prince Zhang immediately rebelled with his followers and Tian Buli, falsely summoning the king under Lord Father's name.

sentences.zh: 肥義先入，殺之。

translations.literal: Fei Yi entered first and killed them.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Yi rushed in first and slew them.

sentences.zh: 高信即與王戰。

translations.literal: Gao Xin immediately fought with the king.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Xin immediately engaged the king in battle.

sentences.zh: 公子成與李兌自國至，乃起四邑之兵入距難，殺公子章及田不禮，滅其黨賊而定王室。

translations.literal: Prince Cheng and Li Kui arrived from the capital, then raised troops from four cities to enter and resist the difficulty, killed Prince Zhang and Tian Buli, exterminated their partisan traitors and pacified the royal house.
translations.idiomatic: Prince Cheng and Li Kui arrived from the capital, raised troops from four cities to confront the crisis, slew Prince Zhang and Tian Buli, exterminated their traitorous partisans, and restored order to the royal house.

sentences.zh: 公子成為相，號安平君，李兌為司寇。

translations.literal: Prince Cheng became chancellor, titled Lord of Anping, Li Kui became judicial minister.
translations.idiomatic: Prince Cheng was appointed chancellor and given the title Lord of Anping; Li Kui became the judicial minister.

sentences.zh: 公子章之敗，往走主父，主主開之，成、兌因圍主父宮。

translations.literal: When Prince Zhang was defeated, he fled to Lord Father. Lord Father opened the door for him, but Cheng and Kui then surrounded Lord Father's palace.
translations.idiomatic: When Prince Zhang was defeated, he fled to Lord Father, who admitted him. But then Prince Cheng and Li Kui surrounded Lord Father's palace.

sentences.zh: 公子章死，公子成、李兌謀曰：「以章故圍主父，即解兵，吾屬夷矣。」

translations.literal: When Prince Zhang died, Prince Cheng and Li Kui plotted: 'Because of Zhang we besieged Lord Father, if we now withdraw troops, we will be executed.'
translations.idiomatic: After Prince Zhang's death, Prince Cheng and Li Kui conferred: 'We besieged Lord Father because of Zhang. If we lift the siege now, we will all be executed.'

sentences.zh: 乃遂圍主父。

translations.literal: Thus they continued to besiege Lord Father.
translations.idiomatic: Thus they maintained the siege on Lord Father.

sentences.zh: 令宮中人「後出者夷」，宮中人悉出。

translations.literal: They ordered the palace people 'Whoever comes out last will be executed,' so all the palace people came out.
translations.idiomatic: They commanded the palace attendants: 'Whoever emerges last will be executed.' All the attendants emerged.

sentences.zh: 主父欲出不得，又不得食，探爵鷇而食之，三月餘而餓死沙丘宮。

translations.literal: Lord Father wished to leave but could not, and could not get food. He picked up the clay cups and ate them, and after more than three months starved to death in the Shaqiu palace.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Father wished to leave but could not, nor could he obtain food. He scraped clay from the cups and ate it. After more than three months, he starved to death in the Shaqiu palace.

sentences.zh: 主父定死，乃發喪赴諸侯。

translations.literal: After Lord Father was confirmed dead, they announced the mourning and informed the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Once Lord Father's death was confirmed, they declared mourning and notified the other feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 是時王少，成、兌專政，畏誅，故圍主父。

translations.literal: At this time the king was young, Cheng and Kui monopolized power, feared execution, thus besieged Lord Father.
translations.idiomatic: At this time the king was young; Prince Cheng and Li Kui held all power and, fearing execution, maintained their siege of Lord Father.

sentences.zh: 主父初以長子章為太子，後得吳娃，愛之，為不出者數歲，生子何，乃廢太子章而立何為王。

translations.literal: Lord Father initially made his eldest son Zhang crown prince, but later obtained Wu woman, loved her, for several years did not leave, gave birth to son He, thus deposed crown prince Zhang and established He as king.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Father had initially designated his eldest son Zhang as crown prince, but later obtained a woman from Wu whom he loved dearly. For several years he did not emerge from seclusion; she bore him a son named He. Thus he deposed the crown prince Zhang and established He as king.

sentences.zh: 吳娃死，愛弛，憐故太子，欲兩王之，猶豫未決，故亂起，以至父子俱死，為天下笑，豈不痛乎！

translations.literal: The Wu woman died, his love faded, pitied the former crown prince, wished to make two kings, hesitated undecided, thus rebellion arose, leading to father and son both dying, becoming the laughingstock of the world—how painful!
translations.idiomatic: After the Wu woman's death, Lord Father's affections waned. He pitied the former crown prince and considered establishing two kings, but hesitated in indecision. Thus rebellion arose, leading to both father and son dying, becoming the laughingstock of the world—how tragic!

sentences.zh: （主父死惠文王立立）五年，與燕鄚、易。

translations.literal: (After Lord Father died, King Huiwen was established) In the fifth year, he exchanged Yan Dan and Yi.
translations.idiomatic: (After Lord Father's death and King Huiwen's ascension) In the fifth year, Zhao exchanged territory with Yan: Dan and Yi.

sentences.zh: 八年，城南行唐。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, he built the city of Nanxing Tang.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, he fortified the city of Xing Tang in the south.

sentences.zh: 九年，趙梁將，與齊合軍攻韓，至魯關下。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Zhao Liang commanded, joined with Qi army to attack Han, reached below Lu pass.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Zhao Liang commanded the army, joined forces with Qi to attack Han, and advanced to below Lu Pass.

sentences.zh: 及十年，秦自置為西帝。

translations.literal: By the tenth year, Qin established itself as Western Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: By the tenth year, Qin proclaimed itself the Western Emperor.

sentences.zh: 十一年，董叔與魏氏伐宋，得河陽於魏。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Dong Shu with the Wei clan attacked Song, obtained Heyang from Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Dong Shu joined with Wei forces to attack Song and captured Heyang from Wei.

sentences.zh: 秦取保陽。

translations.literal: Qin took Baoyang.
translations.idiomatic: Qin captured Baoyang.

sentences.zh: 十二年，趙梁將攻齊。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Zhao Liang commanded and attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Zhao Liang led the attack on Qi.

sentences.zh: 十三年，韓徐為將，攻齊。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Han Xu served as commander and attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Han Xu commanded the attack on Qi.

sentences.zh: 公主死。

translations.literal: The princess died.
translations.idiomatic: The princess died.

sentences.zh: 十四年，相國樂毅將趙、秦、韓、魏、燕攻齊，取靈丘。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Chancellor Yue Yi commanded Zhao, Qin, Han, Wei, Yan to attack Qi, and captured Lingqiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Chancellor Yue Yi led Zhao, Qin, Han, Wei, and Yan in attacking Qi and captured Lingqiu.

sentences.zh: 與秦會中陽。

translations.literal: He met with Qin at Zhongyang.
translations.idiomatic: He met with Qin forces at Zhongyang.

sentences.zh: 十五年，燕昭王來見。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, King Zhao of Yan came to visit.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, King Zhao of Yan paid a visit.

sentences.zh: 趙與韓、魏、秦共擊齊，齊王敗走，燕獨深入，取臨菑。

translations.literal: Zhao together with Han, Wei, Qin attacked Qi; the King of Qi fled in defeat. Yan alone penetrated deeply and captured Linzi.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao joined Han, Wei, and Qin in attacking Qi. The King of Qi fled in defeat, but Yan alone pressed deep into enemy territory and captured Linzi.

sentences.zh: 十六年，秦復與趙數擊齊，齊人患之。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Qin again repeatedly attacked Qi together with Zhao; the people of Qi suffered from it.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Qin repeatedly joined Zhao in attacking Qi, causing great distress to the Qi people.

sentences.zh: 蘇厲為齊遺趙王書曰：

translations.literal: Su Li, on behalf of Qi, sent a letter to the King of Zhao saying:
translations.idiomatic: Su Li, acting for Qi, sent this letter to the King of Zhao:

sentences.zh: 臣聞古之賢君，其德行非布於海內也，教順非洽於民人也，祭祀時享非數常於鬼神也。

translations.literal: Your servant has heard that the virtuous rulers of antiquity did not spread their virtue throughout the realm, nor did their teachings and obedience reach all the people, nor did their sacrifices and seasonal offerings frequently attend to the spirits.
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that the wise rulers of antiquity did not broadcast their virtue throughout the world, nor did their teachings and moral influence permeate all the people, nor did their sacrifices and seasonal offerings constantly attend to the spirits.

sentences.zh: 甘露降，時雨至，年穀豐孰，民不疾疫，眾人善之，然而賢主圖之。

translations.literal: Sweet dew descended, timely rains arrived, the year's grain was abundant and ripe, the people had no diseases or epidemics—everyone praised this, yet the wise ruler planned for it.
translations.idiomatic: Sweet dew falls, timely rains come, the year's harvest is bountiful and ripe, the people suffer no diseases or plagues—all praise this abundance, yet the wise ruler plans ahead for it.

sentences.zh: 今足下之賢行功力，非數加於秦也；

translations.literal: Now your lordship's virtuous conduct and meritorious efforts are not frequently applied to Qin;
translations.idiomatic: Now your lordship's virtuous deeds and meritorious exertions are not frequently directed toward Qin;

sentences.zh: 怨毒積怒，非素深於齊也。

translations.literal: Poisonous resentment and accumulated anger are not deeply rooted in Qi from ancient times.
translations.idiomatic: The poisonous resentment and accumulated anger are not deeply rooted in Qi from ancient times.

sentences.zh: 秦趙與國，以彊征兵於韓，秦誠愛趙乎？

translations.literal: Qin and Zhao are allied states, yet with their strength they conscript troops from Han—does Qin truly love Zhao?
translations.idiomatic: Qin and Zhao are allied states, yet Qin uses its power to conscript troops from Han—does Qin truly cherish Zhao?

sentences.zh: 其實憎齊乎？

translations.literal: Or does Qin actually hate Qi?
translations.idiomatic: Or does Qin actually despise Qi?

sentences.zh: 物之甚者，賢主察之。

translations.literal: Extreme matters among things, the wise ruler examines them.
translations.idiomatic: The wise ruler examines matters that go to extremes.

sentences.zh: 秦非愛趙而憎齊也，欲亡韓而吞二周，故以齊餤天下。

translations.literal: Qin does not love Zhao and hate Qi, but wishes to destroy Han and swallow the two Zhou, thus uses Qi to feed the world.
translations.idiomatic: Qin does not love Zhao and hate Qi; it seeks to destroy Han and devour the two Zhou states, using Qi as bait to lure the world.

sentences.zh: 恐事之不合，故出兵以劫魏、趙。

translations.literal: Fearing that matters would not succeed, thus sent troops to coerce Wei and Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Fearing their plans might fail, they sent troops to intimidate Wei and Zhao.

sentences.zh: 恐天下畏己也，故出質以為信。

translations.literal: Fearing that the world would fear them, thus sent hostages as pledges.
translations.idiomatic: Fearing the world would grow wary of them, they offered hostages as tokens of good faith.

sentences.zh: 恐天下亟反也，故徵兵於韓以威之。

translations.literal: Fearing that the world would quickly rebel, thus conscripted troops from Han to intimidate them.
translations.idiomatic: Fearing the world might revolt swiftly, they conscripted troops from Han to cow the other states.

sentences.zh: 聲以德與國，實而伐空韓，臣以秦計為必出於此。

translations.literal: In name sharing virtue with the states, in reality attacking the empty Han—your servant believes Qin's plan must come from this.
translations.idiomatic: In public they proclaim shared virtue among allies, but in private they attack the vulnerable Han—your servant believes this must be Qin's strategy.

sentences.zh: 夫物固有勢異而患同者，楚久伐而中山亡，今齊久伐而韓必亡。

translations.literal: Indeed, things may have different situations but the same calamities: Chu long attacked and Zhongshan perished, now Qi is long attacked and Han must perish.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, different situations can lead to the same disasters: Chu's prolonged attacks destroyed Zhongshan; Qi's prolonged attacks will surely destroy Han.

sentences.zh: 破齊，王與六國分其利也。

translations.literal: Destroy Qi, and your majesty will divide the benefits with the six states.
translations.idiomatic: If Qi falls, your majesty will share the spoils with the six allied states.

sentences.zh: 亡韓，秦獨擅之。

translations.literal: Destroy Han, and Qin alone will monopolize it.
translations.idiomatic: If Han falls, Qin will claim it all for itself.

sentences.zh: 收二周，西取祭器，秦獨私之。

translations.literal: Take the two Zhou, seize the western ritual vessels, Qin alone will possess them privately.
translations.idiomatic: Qin will seize the two Zhou states and the western ritual vessels, keeping them entirely for itself.

sentences.zh: 賦田計功，王之獲利孰與秦多？

translations.literal: Assess the fields and calculate the merit—who among your majesty and Qin will gain more benefit?
translations.idiomatic: If we tally the lands and weigh the achievements, who will gain more—your majesty or Qin?

sentences.zh: 說士之計曰：「韓亡三川，魏亡晉國，市朝未變而禍已及矣。」

translations.literal: The persuader's plan says: 'If Han loses Sanchuan, Wei loses the state of Jin, though the markets and courts have not changed, calamity has already arrived.'
translations.idiomatic: The strategists calculate: 'If Han loses the Sanchuan region and Wei loses the Jin heartland, though markets and courts remain unchanged, disaster will already have struck.'

sentences.zh: 燕盡齊之北地，去沙丘、鉅鹿斂三百里，韓之上黨去邯鄲百里，燕、秦謀王之河山，閒三百里而通矣。

translations.literal: Yan takes all of Qi's northern territory, is gathered three hundred li from Shaqiu and Julu. Han's Shangdang is one hundred li from Handan. If Yan and Qin covet your majesty's river and mountain borders, they will be connected with only three hundred li between them.
translations.idiomatic: Yan has seized all Qi's northern lands, bringing it within three hundred li of Shaqiu and Julu. Han's Shangdang region lies just one hundred li from Handan. If Yan and Qin scheme against your majesty's borders along the rivers and mountains, they will be linked with only three hundred li separating them.

sentences.zh: 秦之上郡近挺關，至於榆中者千五百里，秦以三郡攻王之上黨，羊腸之西，句注之南，非王有已。

translations.literal: Qin's Shangjun is near Tingguan, reaching to Yuzhong is one thousand five hundred li. If Qin attacks your majesty's Shangdang with three commanderies, west of Yangchang and south of Gubei, it will no longer be your majesty's possession.
translations.idiomatic: Qin's Shang commandery borders Ting Pass and extends fifteen hundred li to Yuzhong. If Qin attacks your majesty's Shangdang region with three commanderies—west of Yangchang Gorge and south of Guju Pass—it will cease to be your territory.

sentences.zh: 踰句注，斬常山而守之，三百里而通於燕，代馬胡犬不東下，昆山之玉不出，此三寶者亦非王有已。

translations.literal: Cross Guju, cut off Changshan and hold it, three hundred li will connect to Yan. Dai horses and barbarian dogs will not come east, Kunshan jade will not come out—these three treasures also will no longer be your majesty's possession.
translations.idiomatic: Once they cross Guju Pass and seize Changshan, holding it fast, they will be only three hundred li from Yan. The fine horses of Dai and barbarian hunting dogs will no longer travel east, nor will the jade of Kunshan emerge—these three treasures will also cease to be your majesty's.

sentences.zh: 王久伐齊，從彊秦攻韓，其禍必至於此。

translations.literal: Your majesty long attacks Qi, follows powerful Qin to attack Han, the calamity must reach this point.
translations.idiomatic: Your majesty's prolonged attacks on Qi and alliance with mighty Qin against Han will surely bring calamity to this pass.

sentences.zh: 願王孰慮之。

translations.literal: I hope your majesty will carefully consider it.
translations.idiomatic: I urge your majesty to ponder this deeply.

sentences.zh: 且齊之所以伐者，以事王也；

translations.literal: Moreover, the reason Qi is being attacked is because of serving your majesty;
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Qi is attacked precisely because it serves your majesty;

sentences.zh: 天下屬行，以謀王也。

translations.literal: The world follows in succession, to plan for your majesty.
translations.idiomatic: The world follows suit, all scheming for your majesty's benefit.

sentences.zh: 燕秦之約成而兵出有日矣。

translations.literal: The agreement between Yan and Qin is completed and troops will be sent on a fixed date.
translations.idiomatic: Yan and Qin's alliance is sealed; their armies will march on schedule.

sentences.zh: 五國三分王之地，齊倍五國之約而殉王之患，西兵以禁彊秦，秦廢帝請服，反高平、根柔於魏，反坙分、先俞於趙。

translations.literal: The five states divide your majesty's lands three ways, Qi doubles the agreement with the five states and shares in your majesty's troubles, western troops to prohibit powerful Qin, Qin abandons the imperial title and requests submission, returns Gaoping and Genrou to Wei, returns Kufen and Xianyu to Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The five states will divide your majesty's territories three ways; Qi will double its commitment to the five-state alliance and share your majesty's burdens; western forces will check mighty Qin; Qin will renounce its imperial title and sue for peace, returning Gaoping and Genrou to Wei, Kufen and Xianyu to Zhao.

sentences.zh: 齊之事王，宜為上佼，而今乃抵罪，臣恐天下後事王者之不敢自必也。

translations.literal: Qi serving your majesty should be the highest merit, but now instead bears the crime, your servant fears that those who serve your majesty later will not dare to be certain.
translations.idiomatic: Qi's service to your majesty should be counted the highest merit, yet now it bears the blame instead. Your servant fears future servants of your majesty will not dare commit themselves fully.

sentences.zh: 願王孰計之也。

translations.literal: I hope your majesty will carefully calculate it.
translations.idiomatic: I urge your majesty to calculate this carefully.

sentences.zh: 今王毋與天下攻齊，天下必以王為義。

translations.literal: Now if your majesty does not join the world in attacking Qi, the world will surely consider your majesty righteous.
translations.idiomatic: If your majesty now refuses to join the world in attacking Qi, the world will surely deem your majesty righteous.

sentences.zh: 齊抱社稷而厚事王，天下必盡重王義。

translations.literal: Qi embraces its altars of soil and grain and serves your majesty loyally, the world will surely all value your majesty's righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Qi clings to its ancestral temples and serves your majesty devotedly; the world will surely honor your majesty's righteousness.

sentences.zh: 王以天下善秦，秦暴，王以天下禁之，是一世之名寵制於王也。

translations.literal: Your majesty uses the world to pressure Qin, if Qin acts tyrannically, your majesty uses the world to prohibit it—this generation's fame and favor will be controlled by your majesty.
translations.idiomatic: Your majesty can use world opinion to pressure Qin; if Qin turns tyrannical, your majesty can use the world to restrain it. The fame and favor of this generation will be yours to command.

sentences.zh: 於是趙乃輟，謝秦不擊齊。

translations.literal: Thus Zhao stopped, apologized to Qin and did not attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Zhao halted its campaign, apologized to Qin, and ceased attacking Qi.

sentences.zh: 王與燕王遇。

translations.literal: The king met with the King of Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The king met with the King of Yan.

sentences.zh: 廉頗將，攻齊昔陽，取之。

translations.literal: Lian Po commanded, attacked Qi's Xiyang, and captured it.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po commanded the attack on Qi's Xiyang and captured it.

sentences.zh: 十七年，樂毅將趙師攻魏伯陽。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, Yue Yi commanded Zhao troops to attack Wei's Boyang.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Yue Yi led Zhao forces in attacking Wei's Boyang.

sentences.zh: 而秦怨趙不與己擊齊，伐趙，拔我兩城。

translations.literal: Qin resented Zhao not joining with it to attack Qi, attacked Zhao, captured two of our cities.
translations.idiomatic: Qin resented Zhao's refusal to join in attacking Qi and launched an attack on Zhao, capturing two of our cities.

sentences.zh: 十八年，秦拔我石城。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Qin captured our Shicheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Qin captured our Shicheng.

sentences.zh: 王再之衛東陽，決河水，伐魏氏。

translations.literal: The king went again to Wei's Dongyang, breached the river waters, attacked the Wei clan.
translations.idiomatic: The king returned to Wei's Dongyang, breached the river dikes, and attacked the Wei clan.

sentences.zh: 大潦，漳水出。

translations.literal: Great floods, the Zhang River overflowed.
translations.idiomatic: Major flooding occurred; the Zhang River overflowed.

sentences.zh: 魏冉來相趙。

translations.literal: Wei Ran came to serve as chancellor of Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Ran arrived to serve as chancellor of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 十九年，秦（敗）［取］我二城。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Qin captured two of our cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Qin captured two of our cities.

sentences.zh: 趙與魏伯陽。

translations.literal: Zhao met with Wei at Boyang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao met with Wei at Boyang.

sentences.zh: 趙奢將，攻齊麥丘，取之。

translations.literal: Zhao She commanded, attacked Qi's Maiqiu, captured it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao She commanded the attack on Qi's Maiqiu and captured it.

sentences.zh: 二十年，廉頗將，攻齊。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Lian Po commanded, attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Lian Po commanded the attack on Qi.

sentences.zh: 王與秦昭王遇西河外。

translations.literal: The king met with Qin Zhao King outside Xibe.
translations.idiomatic: The king met with King Zhao of Qin outside Xibe.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，趙徙漳水武平西。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Zhao moved the Zhang River to the west of Wuping.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Zhao diverted the Zhang River west of Wuping.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，大疫。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, great epidemic.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, a major epidemic struck.

sentences.zh: 置公子丹為太子。

translations.literal: Established Prince Dan as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Prince Dan was established as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，樓昌將，攻魏幾，不能取。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Lou Chang commanded, attacked Wei's Ji, could not capture it.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Lou Chang commanded the attack on Wei's Ji but failed to capture it.

sentences.zh: 十二月，廉頗將，攻幾，取之。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month, Lian Po commanded, attacked Ji, captured it.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, Lian Po commanded the attack on Ji and captured it.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，廉頗將，攻魏房子，拔之，因城而還。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Lian Po commanded, attacked Wei's Fangzi, captured it, fortified it and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Lian Po commanded the attack on Wei's Fangzi, captured it, fortified the position, and returned.

sentences.zh: 又攻安陽，取之。

translations.literal: Again attacked Anyang, captured it.
translations.idiomatic: He then attacked Anyang and captured it.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，燕周將，攻昌城、高唐，取之。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Yan Zhou commanded, attacked Changcheng and Gaotang, captured them.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Yan Zhou commanded the attack on Changcheng and Gaotang and captured them.

sentences.zh: 與魏共擊秦。

translations.literal: Together with Wei attacked Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Together with Wei, they attacked Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦將白起破我華陽，得一將軍。

translations.literal: Qin's general Bai Qi defeated our Huayang, captured one general.
translations.idiomatic: Qin's general Bai Qi defeated our forces at Huayang and captured one of our generals.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，取東胡歐代地。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, conquered Eastern Hu Ou and Dai territories.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Zhao conquered Eastern Hu territories as far as Ou and Dai.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，徙漳水武平南。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, moved the Zhang River south of Wuping.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, the Zhang River was diverted south of Wuping.

sentences.zh: 封趙豹為平陽君。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed Zhao Bao as Lord of Pingyang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Bao was enfeoffed as Lord of Pingyang.

sentences.zh: 河水出，大潦。

translations.literal: Yellow River overflowed, great floods.
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow River overflowed, causing major flooding.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，藺相如伐齊，至平邑。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Lin Xiangru attacked Qi, reached Pingyi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Lin Xiangru attacked Qi and advanced as far as Pingyi.

sentences.zh: 罷城北九門大城。

translations.literal: Abandoned fortifying the great city north of Jiu Gate.
translations.idiomatic: Construction was abandoned on the great city north of Jiu Gate.

sentences.zh: 燕將成安君公孫操弒其王。

translations.literal: Yan's general Lord Cheng'an Gongsun Cao assassinated his king.
translations.idiomatic: Yan's general, Lord Cheng'an Gongsun Cao, assassinated his king.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，秦、韓相攻，而圍閼與。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin and Han attacked each other, and besieged Yan and Yu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin and Han attacked each other and jointly besieged Yan and Yu.

sentences.zh: 趙使趙奢將，擊秦，大破秦軍閼與下，賜號為馬服君。

translations.literal: Zhao sent Zhao She to command, attacked Qin, greatly defeated the Qin army below Yan and Yu, granted the title Ma Fu Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao sent Zhao She to command the attack on Qin. He decisively defeated the Qin army below Yan and Yu and was granted the title Lord Ma Fu.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，惠文王卒，太子丹立，是為孝成王。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, King Huiwen died, Crown Prince Dan ascended the throne, this was King Xiaocheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, King Huiwen died. Crown Prince Dan ascended the throne as King Xiaocheng.

sentences.zh: 孝成王元年，秦伐我，拔三城。

translations.literal: In the first year of King Xiaocheng, Qin attacked us, captured three cities.
translations.idiomatic: In King Xiaocheng's first year, Qin attacked Zhao and captured three cities.

sentences.zh: 趙王新立，太后用事，秦急攻之。

translations.literal: The King of Zhao had newly ascended, the Dowager Queen was in power, Qin urgently attacked them.
translations.idiomatic: The king of Zhao had just ascended the throne; the dowager queen held power. Qin launched urgent attacks against them.

sentences.zh: 趙氏求救於齊，齊曰：「必以長安君為質，兵乃出。」

translations.literal: The Zhao clan sought aid from Qi, Qi said: 'You must send the Lord of Chang'an as hostage, then troops will be sent.'
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao court sought aid from Qi. Qi replied: 'Send the Lord of Chang'an as hostage, and we will dispatch troops.'

sentences.zh: 太后不肯，大臣彊諫。

translations.literal: The Dowager Queen refused, the ministers strongly remonstrated.
translations.idiomatic: The dowager queen refused. Her ministers strongly urged her to reconsider.

sentences.zh: 太后明謂左右曰：「復言長安君為質者，老婦必唾其面。」

translations.literal: The Dowager Queen clearly told those around her: 'Whoever again speaks of sending the Lord of Chang'an as hostage, this old woman will spit in their face.'
translations.idiomatic: The dowager queen declared to her attendants: 'Anyone who dares mention sending the Lord of Chang'an as hostage again will get my spittle in their face.'

sentences.zh: 左師觸龍言願見太后，太后盛氣而胥之。

translations.literal: The Left Tutor Zhuo Long said he wished to see the Dowager Queen, the Dowager Queen in great anger waited for him.
translations.idiomatic: Left Tutor Zhuo Long requested an audience with the dowager queen, who received him in a towering rage.

sentences.zh: 入，徐趨而坐，自謝曰：「老臣病足，曾不能疾走，不得見久矣。

translations.literal: He entered, slowly approached and sat, apologized to himself: 'This old minister has sick feet, has not been able to walk quickly, has not seen you for a long time.'
translations.idiomatic: He entered, approached slowly, and took his seat. He apologized: 'This old minister's feet are diseased; I cannot walk quickly. It has been too long since I saw your majesty.'

sentences.zh: 竊自恕，而恐太后體之有所苦也，故願望見太后。」

translations.literal: 'I secretly excuse myself, but feared that your majesty's body might be suffering somewhat, thus I wished to have an audience with your majesty.'
translations.idiomatic: 'I privately excused myself from court, but I worried that your majesty might be ailing. Thus I wished to pay my respects.'

sentences.zh: 太后曰：「老婦恃輦而行耳。」

translations.literal: The Dowager Queen said: 'This old woman relies on a palanquin to get around.'
translations.idiomatic: The dowager queen replied: 'This old woman gets about by palanquin these days.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「食得毋衰乎？」

translations.literal: 'Is your appetite perhaps declining?'
translations.idiomatic: 'And is your appetite perhaps diminished?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「恃粥耳。」

translations.literal: 'I rely on gruel.'
translations.idiomatic: 'I manage on thin gruel.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「老臣閒者殊不欲食，乃彊步，日三四里，少益嗜食，和於身也。」

translations.literal: 'This old minister recently had no desire for food, so I forced myself to walk, three or four li per day, gradually improved my appetite, and it harmonizes my body.'
translations.idiomatic: 'This old minister recently lost all appetite for food. I forced myself to walk three or four li each day. Gradually my appetite improved, bringing harmony to my body.'

sentences.zh: 太后曰：「老婦不能。」

translations.literal: The Dowager Queen said: 'This old woman cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: The dowager queen said: 'This old woman cannot manage that.'

sentences.zh: 太后不和之色少解。

translations.literal: The Dowager Queen's angry expression slightly relaxed.
translations.idiomatic: The dowager queen's angry expression softened slightly.

sentences.zh: 左師公曰：「老臣賤息舒祺最少，不肖，而臣衰，竊憐愛之，願得補黑衣之缺以衛王宮，昧死以聞。」

translations.literal: The Left Tutor said: 'This old minister's humble son Shuqi is the youngest, unworthy, and since I am declining, I secretly cherish and love him, I wish to obtain a position in the black-robed guards to protect the royal palace, I risk death in making this request.'
translations.idiomatic: The Left Tutor continued: 'This old minister's youngest son, Shuqi, is quite unworthy. As I grow feeble, I cherish him dearly. I humbly request that he be given a position among the black-robed guards to protect the royal palace. I risk death in making this plea.'

sentences.zh: 太后曰：「敬諾。

translations.literal: The Dowager Queen said: 'I respectfully comply.
translations.idiomatic: The dowager queen replied: 'I respectfully agree.

sentences.zh: 年幾何矣？」

translations.literal: How old is he?'
translations.idiomatic: How old is he?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「十五歲矣。

translations.literal: He replied: 'Fifteen years old.
translations.idiomatic: He answered: 'Fifteen years old.

sentences.zh: 雖少，願及未填溝壑而託之。」

translations.literal: Though young, I wish to entrust him while I have not yet filled the ditches and graves.'
translations.idiomatic: Though young, I wish to secure his position before I die and fill the grave.'

sentences.zh: 太后曰：「丈夫亦愛憐少子乎？」

translations.literal: The Dowager Queen said: 'Do men also cherish their youngest sons?'
translations.idiomatic: The dowager queen asked: 'Do fathers also dote on their youngest sons?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「甚於婦人。」

translations.literal: He replied: 'More than women do.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Even more than women do.'

sentences.zh: 太后笑曰：「婦人異甚。」

translations.literal: The Dowager Queen laughed and said: 'Women are exceedingly different.'
translations.idiomatic: The dowager queen laughed: 'Women are quite different indeed.'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「老臣竊以為媼之愛燕后賢於長安君。」

translations.literal: He replied: 'This old minister privately believes that your majesty's love for the Queen of Yan surpasses that for the Lord of Chang'an.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'This old minister privately believes your majesty loves the Queen of Yan more than the Lord of Chang'an.'

sentences.zh: 太后曰：「君過矣，不若長安君之甚。」

translations.literal: The Dowager Queen said: 'You are mistaken, it is not as great as for the Lord of Chang'an.'
translations.idiomatic: The dowager queen said: 'You are wrong. I do not love her as much as I love the Lord of Chang'an.'

sentences.zh: 左師公曰：「父母愛子則為之計深遠。

translations.literal: The Left Tutor said: 'When parents love their children, they plan deeply for them.
translations.idiomatic: The Left Tutor said: 'When parents truly love their children, they plan far ahead for them.

sentences.zh: 媼之送燕后也，持其踵，為之泣，念其遠也，亦哀之矣。

translations.literal: When your majesty sent away the Queen of Yan, you held her feet, wept for her, thinking of her distance, and grieved for her.'
translations.idiomatic: When your majesty sent the Queen of Yan away, you clutched her feet and wept, grieving over her distant journey.'

sentences.zh: 已行，非不思也，祭祀則祝之曰『必勿使反』，豈非計長久，為子孫相繼為王也哉？」

translations.literal: Once she had departed, you did not cease thinking of her. During sacrifices you prayed: 'Do not let her return.' Was this not planning for the long term, ensuring that her descendants would succeed each other as kings?'
translations.idiomatic: Even after she left, you never stopped thinking of her. At sacrifices you prayed: 'Never let her return.' Was this not long-term planning to ensure her descendants would reign as kings in succession?'

sentences.zh: 太后曰：「然。」

translations.literal: The Dowager Queen said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: The dowager queen said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 左師公曰：「今三世以前，至於趙主之子孫為侯者，其繼有在者乎？」

translations.literal: The Left Tutor said: 'Now, from three generations ago until now, among the descendants of Zhao rulers who became marquises, are any of their successors still extant?'
translations.idiomatic: The Left Tutor said: 'Now, looking back three generations to the present day, among the descendants of Zhao rulers who were enfeoffed as marquises, do any of their successors still hold their positions?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「無有。」

translations.literal: She said: 'None.'
translations.idiomatic: She replied: 'None.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「微獨趙，諸侯有在者乎？」

translations.literal: She said: 'Not only Zhao, are there any among the other feudal lords who still exist?'
translations.idiomatic: She asked: 'Not just Zhao—do any of the other feudal lords' descendants still hold their positions?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「老婦不聞也。」

translations.literal: She said: 'This old woman has not heard of any.'
translations.idiomatic: She replied: 'This old woman has heard of none.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「此其近者禍及其身，遠者及其子孫。

translations.literal: He said: 'This is because the near ones' calamity reaches their own persons, the distant ones' reaches their descendants.
translations.idiomatic: He explained: 'This happens because for those close in time, calamity strikes their own persons; for those more distant, it reaches their descendants.

sentences.zh: 豈人主之子侯則不善哉？

translations.literal: Could it be that the sons of rulers who become marquises are not good?'
translations.idiomatic: Could it be that the sons of rulers who are enfeoffed as marquises are somehow unworthy?'

sentences.zh: 位尊而無功，奉厚而無勞，而挾重器多也。

translations.literal: 'Their position is honored but without merit, their emoluments thick but without labor, yet they hold many precious vessels.'
translations.idiomatic: 'They hold honored positions without merit, receive rich stipends without labor, yet possess many precious treasures.'

sentences.zh: 今媼尊長安君之位，而封之以膏腴之地，多與之重器，而不及今令有功於國，一旦山陵崩，長安君何以自託於趙？

translations.literal: 'Now your majesty honors the Lord of Chang'an's position, enfeoffs him with fertile lands, gives him many precious vessels, but does not cause him to have merit for the state now. Once the mountain tomb collapses, how will the Lord of Chang'an establish himself in Zhao?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Now your majesty exalts the Lord of Chang'an's position and grants him fertile lands and many treasures, but does not give him the chance to earn merit for the state. When you pass away, how will the Lord of Chang'an secure his position in Zhao?'

sentences.zh: 老臣以媼為長安君之計短也，故以為愛之不若燕后。」

translations.literal: 'This old minister believes your majesty's planning for the Lord of Chang'an is short-sighted, thus I believe your love for him does not surpass that for the Queen of Yan.'
translations.idiomatic: 'This old minister believes your majesty's planning for the Lord of Chang'an is shortsighted. Therefore, I submit that your love for him does not equal your love for the Queen of Yan.'

sentences.zh: 太后曰：「諾，恣君之所使之。」

translations.literal: The Dowager Queen said: 'Very well, I leave it to you to arrange as you see fit.'
translations.idiomatic: The dowager queen said: 'Very well. I entrust you to handle this as you see fit.'

sentences.zh: 於是為長安君約車百乘，質於齊，齊兵乃出。

translations.literal: Thus they prepared a hundred chariots for the Lord of Chang'an and sent him as hostage to Qi; Qi's troops then marched out.
translations.idiomatic: Thus they equipped the Lord of Chang'an with a hundred chariots and sent him as hostage to Qi. Only then did Qi dispatch its troops.

sentences.zh: 子義聞之，曰：「人主之子，骨肉之親也，猶不能持無功之尊，無勞之奉，而守金玉之重也，而況於予乎？」

translations.literal: Zi Yi heard of it and said: 'The sons of rulers, being flesh and blood kin, still cannot maintain honored positions without merit, rich emoluments without labor, and hold precious vessels and treasures—how much less can I?'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Yi heard this and remarked: 'Even the sons of rulers, who share flesh and blood with their fathers, cannot maintain honored positions without merit, rich stipends without labor, or hold precious treasures—how much less can a mere subject like me?'

sentences.zh: 齊安平君田單將趙師而攻燕中陽，拔之。

translations.literal: Qi's Lord of Anping Tian Dan commanded Zhao troops and attacked Yan's Zhongyang, capturing it.
translations.idiomatic: Qi's Lord of Anping, Tian Dan, led Zhao forces in attacking Yan's Zhongyang and captured it.

sentences.zh: 又攻韓注人，拔之。

translations.literal: He again attacked Han's Zhuren, capturing it.
translations.idiomatic: He then attacked Han's Zhuren and captured it.

sentences.zh: 二年，惠文后卒。

translations.literal: In the second year, Empress Huiwen died.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Empress Huiwen passed away.

sentences.zh: 田單為相。

translations.literal: Tian Dan became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Dan was appointed chancellor.

sentences.zh: 四年，王夢衣偏裻之衣，乘飛龍上天，不至而墜，見金玉之積如山。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, the king dreamed he wore one-sided fur clothing, rode a flying dragon up to heaven, but did not reach it and fell, seeing accumulations of gold and jade like mountains.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, the king dreamed he wore a one-sided fur robe, rode a flying dragon toward heaven, but fell short and plummeted down, beholding mountains of gold and jade piled up.

sentences.zh: 明日，王召筮史敢占之，曰：「夢衣偏裻之衣者，殘也。

translations.literal: The next day, the king summoned the diviner Gan to interpret it, saying: 'Dreaming of wearing one-sided fur clothing means residual/incomplete.'
translations.idiomatic: The next day, the king summoned the diviner Shi Gan to interpret the dream: 'Dreaming of wearing one-sided fur clothing signifies something incomplete.'

sentences.zh: 乘飛龍上天不至而墜者，有氣而無實也。

translations.literal: 'Riding a flying dragon up to heaven but not reaching it and falling means having form but no substance.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Riding a flying dragon toward heaven but falling short signifies having appearance without substance.'

sentences.zh: 見金玉之積如山者，憂也。」

translations.literal: 'Seeing accumulations of gold and jade like mountains means worry.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Seeing mountains of gold and jade piled up signifies anxiety.'

sentences.zh: 後三日，韓氏上黨守馮亭使者至，曰：「韓不能守上黨，入之於秦。

translations.literal: Three days later, the envoy of Han's Shangdang governor Feng Ting arrived, saying: 'Han cannot defend Shangdang and will cede it to Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: Three days later, an envoy from Han's governor of Shangdang, Feng Ting, arrived and said: 'Han cannot hold Shangdang and will cede it to Qin.'

sentences.zh: 其吏民皆安為趙，不欲為秦。

translations.literal: 'Its officials and people would all prefer to be Zhao subjects, they do not wish to be Qin subjects.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Its officials and people would all prefer to become Zhao subjects; they do not wish to become Qin subjects.'

sentences.zh: 有城市邑十七，願再拜入之趙，財王所以賜吏民。」

translations.literal: 'There are seventeen cities and towns; we wish to bow twice and offer them to Zhao, for your majesty to reward the officials and people as you see fit.'
translations.idiomatic: 'There are seventeen cities and towns. We humbly offer them to Zhao with repeated bows, for your majesty to bestow rewards on the officials and people as you see fit.'

sentences.zh: 王大喜，召平陽君豹告之曰：「馮亭入城市邑十七，受之何如？」

translations.literal: The king was greatly pleased, summoned the Lord of Pingyang Zhao Bao and told him: 'Feng Ting is offering seventeen cities and towns—what do you think of accepting?'
translations.idiomatic: The king was overjoyed and summoned Zhao Bao, Lord of Pingyang, to tell him: 'Feng Ting is offering seventeen cities and towns. What do you think of accepting them?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「聖人甚禍無故之利。」

translations.literal: He replied: 'The sages greatly fear unearned benefits.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'The sages greatly fear benefits that come without cause.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「人懷吾德，何謂無故乎？」

translations.literal: The king said: 'People cherish my virtue—what do you mean by unearned?'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'People are drawn to my benevolence. How can this be called unearned?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「夫秦蠶食韓氏地，中絕不令相通，固自以為坐而受上黨之地也。

translations.literal: He replied: 'Qin has been nibbling away at Han's territory, cutting it off in the middle so it cannot connect, and certainly expects to sit and receive Shangdang's lands.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Qin has been nibbling away at Han's territory like a silkworm, cutting off connections in the middle. They fully expect to sit back and receive Shangdang's lands without effort.'

sentences.zh: 韓氏所以不入於秦者，欲嫁其禍於趙也。

translations.literal: 'The reason Han does not cede to Qin is that they wish to shift their calamity to Zhao.'
translations.idiomatic: 'The reason Han won't cede to Qin is that they want to shift their disaster onto Zhao.'

sentences.zh: 秦服其勞而趙受其利，雖彊大不能得之於小弱，小弱顧能得之於彊大乎？

translations.literal: 'Qin bears the effort while Zhao receives the benefit—though the strong cannot take from the weak, how can the weak take from the strong?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Qin bears all the effort while Zhao reaps the benefit. Even the strong cannot seize from the weak—what makes you think the weak can seize from the strong?'

sentences.zh: 豈可謂非無故之利哉！

translations.literal: 'How can this not be called unearned benefit!'
translations.idiomatic: 'How can this not be called a benefit without cause!'

sentences.zh: 且夫秦以牛田之水通糧蠶食，上乘倍戰者，裂上國之地，其政行，不可與為難，必勿受也。」

translations.literal: 'Moreover, Qin uses the Nitian waterway to transport grain while nibbling away, their elite troops fight with double strength, splitting the lands of superior states—their governance succeeds, one cannot contend with them. You must not accept.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Moreover, Qin uses the Nitian waterway to transport grain while steadily encroaching. Their elite troops fight with double efficiency, carving up the territories of superior states. Their administration succeeds; one cannot challenge them. You must not accept.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「今發百萬之軍而攻，踰年歷歲未得一城也。

translations.literal: The king said: 'Now if we dispatch a million-man army to attack, it would take years and still not capture a single city.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'If we dispatch a million-man army to attack, it would take years and we still might not capture a single city.'

sentences.zh: 今以城市邑十七幣吾國，此大利也。」

translations.literal: 'Now with seventeen cities and towns enriching our state, this is great benefit.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Now seventeen cities and towns enrich our state—this is tremendous benefit.'

sentences.zh: 趙豹出，王召平原君與趙禹而告之。

translations.literal: Zhao Bao left, the king summoned the Lord of Pingyuan and Zhao Yu and told them.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Bao departed. The king summoned the Lord of Pingyuan and Zhao Yu to inform them.

sentences.zh: 對曰：「發百萬之軍而攻，踰歲未得一城，今坐受城市邑十七，此大利，不可失也。」

translations.literal: They replied: 'If we dispatch a million-man army to attack, it would take a year and still not capture one city. Now we sit and receive seventeen cities and towns—this is great benefit, we cannot lose it.'
translations.idiomatic: They replied: 'If we dispatch a million-man army to attack, it would take over a year and we still might not capture one city. Now we receive seventeen cities and towns without effort—this is tremendous benefit. We cannot let it slip away.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「善。」

translations.literal: The king said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Excellent.'

sentences.zh: 乃令趙勝受地，告馮亭曰：「敝國使者臣勝，敝國君使勝致命，以萬戶都三封太守，千戶都三封縣令，皆世世為侯，吏民皆益爵三級，吏民能相安，皆賜之六金。」

translations.literal: Thus he ordered Zhao Sheng to receive the territory and told Feng Ting: 'Our state's envoy, your servant Sheng, our state's ruler has sent Sheng to convey: Ten thousand household cities will be made into three commanderies for governors, thousand household cities will be made into three counties for magistrates, all will be marquises generation after generation. Officials and people will all advance three ranks in nobility. Officials and people who can live in harmony will all be granted six pieces of gold.'
translations.idiomatic: Thus he ordered Zhao Sheng to accept the territory and told Feng Ting: 'Our humble state's envoy, your servant Zhao Sheng. Our lord has sent me to convey: Cities of ten thousand households shall be made into three commanderies with governors; cities of thousand households into three counties with magistrates. All shall be marquises for generations. Officials and people shall all advance three ranks. Those officials and people who live in harmony shall each receive six pieces of gold.'

sentences.zh: 馮亭垂涕不見使者，曰：「吾不處三不義也：為主守地，不能死固，不義一矣；

translations.literal: Feng Ting wept and would not see the envoy, saying: 'I will not commit three unrighteous acts: Serving my lord to guard territory, I could not die defending it—this is the first unrighteousness;'
translations.idiomatic: Feng Ting wept and refused to see the envoy, declaring: 'I will not commit three acts of unrighteousness. As guardian of my lord's territory, I could not die defending it—that is the first unrighteousness;'

sentences.zh: 入之秦，不聽主令，不義二矣；

translations.literal: 'Ceding it to Qin, I did not obey my lord's command—this is the second unrighteousness;'
translations.idiomatic: 'To cede it to Qin without obeying my lord's command—that is the second unrighteousness;'

sentences.zh: 賣主地而食之，不義三矣。」

translations.literal: 'Selling my lord's territory and profiting from it—this is the third unrighteousness.'
translations.idiomatic: 'To sell my lord's territory for personal gain—that is the third unrighteousness.'

sentences.zh: 趙遂發兵取上黨。

translations.literal: Zhao thus dispatched troops to take Shangdang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao thus sent troops to seize Shangdang.

sentences.zh: 廉頗將軍軍長平。

translations.literal: Lian Po commanded the army at Changping.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po commanded the army stationed at Changping.

sentences.zh: 七（年）［月］，廉頗免而趙括代將。

translations.literal: In the seventh month, Lian Po was dismissed and Zhao Kuo replaced him as commander.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month, Lian Po was relieved of command and Zhao Kuo took his place.

sentences.zh: 秦人圍趙括，趙括以軍降，卒四十餘萬皆阬之。

translations.literal: The Qin surrounded Zhao Kuo, Zhao Kuo surrendered with his army, and over 400,000 troops were all buried alive.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin surrounded Zhao Kuo. Zhao Kuo surrendered his entire army, and over 400,000 soldiers were buried alive.

sentences.zh: 王悔不聽趙豹之計，故有長平之禍焉。

translations.literal: The king regretted not listening to Zhao Bao's advice, thus there was the Changping disaster.
translations.idiomatic: The king bitterly regretted ignoring Zhao Bao's counsel, thus bringing about the Changping catastrophe.

sentences.zh: 王還，不聽秦，秦圍邯鄲。

translations.literal: The king returned, did not heed Qin, Qin besieged Handan.
translations.idiomatic: The king returned home but refused to heed Qin. Qin then besieged Handan.

sentences.zh: 武垣令傅豹、王容、蘇射率燕眾反燕地。

translations.literal: The magistrate of Wuyuan, Fu Bao, Wang Rong, and Su She led Yan troops to rebel in Yan territory.
translations.idiomatic: The magistrate of Wuyuan—Fu Bao, Wang Rong, and Su She—led Yan forces in rebellion within Yan territory.

sentences.zh: 趙以靈丘封楚相春申君。

translations.literal: Zhao enfeoffed Lingqiu to Chu's chancellor Lord Chunshen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao granted Lingqiu as fief to Chu's chancellor, the Lord of Chunshen.

sentences.zh: 八年，平原君如楚請救。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, the Lord of Pingyuan went to Chu to request aid.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, the Lord of Pingyuan traveled to Chu to seek assistance.

sentences.zh: 還，楚來救，及魏公子無忌亦來救，秦圍邯鄲乃解。

translations.literal: Upon returning, Chu came to aid, and Wei's Prince Wuji also came to aid, thus Qin's siege of Handan was lifted.
translations.idiomatic: Upon his return, Chu sent troops to aid Zhao. Wei's Prince Wuji also arrived with reinforcements. Qin's siege of Handan was finally broken.

sentences.zh: 十年，燕攻昌壯，五月拔之。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Yan attacked Changzhuang, capturing it in the fifth month.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Yan attacked Changzhuang and captured it by the fifth month.

sentences.zh: 趙將樂乘、慶舍攻秦信梁軍，破之。

translations.literal: Zhao generals Yue Cheng and Qing She attacked Qin's Xinliang army, defeating it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao generals Yue Cheng and Qing She attacked and defeated Qin's Xinliang army.

sentences.zh: 太子死。

translations.literal: The crown prince died.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince died.

sentences.zh: 而秦攻西周，拔之。

translations.literal: Meanwhile Qin attacked Western Zhou, capturing it.
translations.idiomatic: Meanwhile, Qin attacked and captured Western Zhou.

sentences.zh: 徒父祺出。

translations.literal: Tu Fuqi went out.
translations.idiomatic: Tu Fuqi departed.

sentences.zh: 十一年，城元氏，縣上原。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, they built city walls at Yuanshi, made Shangyuan a county.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, they fortified Yuanshi with city walls and established Shangyuan as a county.

sentences.zh: 武陽君鄭安平死，收其地。

translations.literal: Lord of Wuyang Zheng Anping died, his territory was recovered.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Wuyang, Zheng Anping, died and his territory was reclaimed.

sentences.zh: 十二年，邯鄲廥燒。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Handan's granaries burned.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Handan's granaries burned down.

sentences.zh: 十四年，平原君趙勝死。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, the Lord of Pingyuan Zhao Sheng died.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, the Lord of Pingyuan, Zhao Sheng, passed away.

sentences.zh: 十五年，以尉文封相國廉頗為信平君。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, with Yuwen he enfeoffed Chancellor Lian Po as Lord of Xinping.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, he granted Chancellor Lian Po the title Lord of Xinping along with the Yuwen estate.

sentences.zh: 燕王令丞相栗腹約驤，以五百金為趙王酒，還歸，報燕王曰：「趙氏壯者皆死長平，其孤未壯，可伐也。」

translations.literal: The King of Yan ordered Chancellor Li Fu to make a covenant with Zhao, using five hundred pieces of gold to toast the King of Zhao. Upon returning, he reported to the King of Yan: 'Zhao's able-bodied men all died at Changping, their orphans have not yet grown up, we can attack them.'
translations.idiomatic: The King of Yan ordered Chancellor Li Fu to negotiate an alliance with Zhao, offering five hundred pieces of gold to toast the King of Zhao. Upon returning home, he reported to the King of Yan: 'Zhao's fighting men all perished at Changping; their orphans are still children. Now is the time to attack.'

sentences.zh: 王召昌國君樂閒而問之。

translations.literal: The king summoned the Lord of Changguo Yue Xian and asked him.
translations.idiomatic: The king summoned Yue Xian, Lord of Changguo, and consulted him.

sentences.zh: 對曰：「趙，四戰之國也，其民習兵，伐之不可。」

translations.literal: He replied: 'Zhao is a country that fights on four fronts, its people are accustomed to warfare, it cannot be attacked.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Zhao is a nation hardened by constant warfare on four borders; its people are battle-tested. It would be folly to attack them.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「吾以眾伐寡，二而伐一，可乎？」

translations.literal: The king said: 'If I attack with many against few, two against one, would that be acceptable?'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'What if I attack with superior numbers—two against one?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不可。」

translations.literal: He replied: 'It would not.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Still not advisable.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「吾即以五而伐一，可乎？」

translations.literal: The king said: 'What if I attack with five against one?'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'What if I attack with five to one odds?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不可。」

translations.literal: He replied: 'It would not.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Even then, it would not be wise.'

sentences.zh: 燕王大怒。

translations.literal: The King of Yan was greatly angered.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Yan flew into a rage.

sentences.zh: 群臣皆以為可。

translations.literal: All the ministers considered it acceptable.
translations.idiomatic: All his ministers urged him to proceed.

sentences.zh: 燕卒起二軍，車二千乘，栗腹將而攻鄗，卿秦將而攻代。

translations.literal: Yan raised two armies with two thousand chariots, Li Fu commanded and attacked Xiang, Qing Qin commanded and attacked Dai.
translations.idiomatic: Yan mobilized two armies with two thousand chariots. Li Fu led the attack on Xiang; Qing Qin commanded the assault on Dai.

sentences.zh: 廉頗為趙將，破殺栗腹，虜卿秦、樂閒。

translations.literal: Lian Po served as Zhao's general, defeated and killed Li Fu, captured Qing Qin and Yue Xian.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po, commanding Zhao's forces, defeated and slew Li Fu, taking Qing Qin and Yue Xian prisoner.

sentences.zh: 十六年，廉頗圍燕。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Lian Po besieged Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Lian Po laid siege to Yan.

sentences.zh: 以樂乘為武襄君。

translations.literal: He made Yue Cheng the Lord of Wuxiang.
translations.idiomatic: He granted Yue Cheng the title Lord of Wuxiang.

sentences.zh: 十七年，假相大將武襄君攻燕，圍其國。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, the acting chancellor and great general Lord of Wuxiang attacked Yan, besieging their capital.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, the acting chancellor and supreme commander Lord of Wuxiang attacked Yan and besieged its capital.

sentences.zh: 十八年，延陵鈞率師從相國信平君助魏攻燕。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Yanling Gou led troops following Chancellor Lord of Xinping to assist Wei in attacking Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Yanling Gou led troops under Chancellor Lord of Xinping to assist Wei's attack on Yan.

sentences.zh: 秦拔我榆次三十七城。

translations.literal: Qin captured our thirty-seven cities at Yuci.
translations.idiomatic: Qin captured thirty-seven of our cities at Yuci.

sentences.zh: 十九年，趙與燕易土：以龍兌、汾門、臨樂與燕；

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Zhao and Yan exchanged territory: giving Longdui, Fenmen, and Linle to Yan;
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Zhao and Yan exchanged territories: Zhao ceded Longdui, Fenmen, and Linle to Yan;

sentences.zh: 燕以葛、武陽、平舒與趙。

translations.literal: Yan gave Ge, Wuyang, and Pingshu to Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Yan ceded Ge, Wuyang, and Pingshu to Zhao.

sentences.zh: 二十年，秦王政初立。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Qin King Zheng first ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Qin King Zheng ascended the throne for the first time.

sentences.zh: 秦拔我晉陽。

translations.literal: Qin captured our Jinyang.
translations.idiomatic: Qin captured our Jinyang.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，孝成王卒。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, King Xiaocheng died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, King Xiaocheng passed away.

sentences.zh: 廉頗將，攻繁陽，取之。

translations.literal: Lian Po commanded, attacked Fanyang, captured it.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po commanded the attack on Fanyang and captured it.

sentences.zh: 使樂乘代之，廉頗攻樂乘，樂乘走，廉頗亡入魏。

translations.literal: They sent Yue Cheng to replace him, Lian Po attacked Yue Cheng, Yue Cheng fled, Lian Po fled into Wei.
translations.idiomatic: They sent Yue Cheng to replace him. Lian Po attacked Yue Cheng, who fled. Lian Po then fled to Wei.

sentences.zh: 子偃立，是為悼襄王。

translations.literal: Zi Yan ascended the throne, this was King Daoxiang.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Yan ascended the throne as King Daoxiang.

sentences.zh: 悼襄王元年，大備魏。

translations.literal: In the first year of King Daoxiang, he made great preparations against Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In King Daoxiang's first year, he made extensive preparations against Wei.

sentences.zh: 欲通平邑、中牟之道，不成。

translations.literal: He wished to open the road from Pingyi to Zhongmu, but did not succeed.
translations.idiomatic: He attempted to open a road from Pingyi to Zhongmu but failed.

sentences.zh: 二年，李牧將，攻燕，拔武遂、方城。

translations.literal: In the second year, Li Mu commanded, attacked Yan, captured Wushui and Fangcheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Li Mu commanded the attack on Yan and captured Wushui and Fangcheng.

sentences.zh: 秦召春平君，因而留之。

translations.literal: Qin summoned the Lord of Chunping and detained him there.
translations.idiomatic: Qin summoned the Lord of Chunping and detained him as hostage.

sentences.zh: 泄鈞為之謂文信侯曰：「春平君者，趙王甚愛之而郎中之，故相與謀曰『春平君入秦，秦必留之』，故相與謀而內之秦也。

translations.literal: Xie Gou said to the Lord of Wenxin on his behalf: 'The Lord of Chunping is greatly loved by the King of Zhao and is among his attendants, thus they plotted together saying "If the Lord of Chunping enters Qin, Qin will certainly detain him", thus they plotted together and sent him into Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: Xie Gou said to the Lord of Wenxin on his behalf: 'The Lord of Chunping is deeply cherished by the King of Zhao and serves among his attendants. They plotted together, saying: "If the Lord of Chunping enters Qin, Qin will certainly detain him." Thus they conspired to send him into Qin.'

sentences.zh: 今君留之，是絕趙而郎中之計中也。

translations.literal: 'Now if you detain him, this severs Zhao and fulfills the attendants' plot.'
translations.idiomatic: 'If you detain him now, you will alienate Zhao and play right into the attendants' scheme.'

sentences.zh: 君不如遣春平君而留平都。

translations.literal: 'You should release the Lord of Chunping and detain Pingdu instead.'
translations.idiomatic: 'You would do better to release the Lord of Chunping and detain Pingdu instead.'

sentences.zh: 春平君者言行信於王，王必厚割趙而贖平都。」

translations.literal: 'The Lord of Chunping's words and conduct are trusted by the king, the king will certainly cede much Zhao territory to ransom Pingdu.'
translations.idiomatic: 'The Lord of Chunping has the king's complete trust in word and deed. The king will surely cede substantial Zhao territory to ransom Pingdu.'

sentences.zh: 文信侯曰：「善。」

translations.literal: The Lord of Wenxin said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Wenxin replied: 'Excellent.'

sentences.zh: 因遣之。

translations.literal: Thus he sent him back.
translations.idiomatic: Thus he released him.

sentences.zh: 城韓皋。

translations.literal: He fortified Hanga with city walls.
translations.idiomatic: He built fortifications at Hanga.

sentences.zh: 三年，龐煖將，攻燕，禽其將劇辛。

translations.literal: In the third year, Pang Juan commanded, attacked Yan, captured their general Ju Xin.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Pang Juan commanded the attack on Yan and captured their general Ju Xin.

sentences.zh: 四年，龐煖將趙、楚、魏、燕之銳師，攻秦蕞，不拔；

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Pang Juan commanded Zhao, Chu, Wei, Yan's elite troops, attacked Qin's Zhui, did not capture it;
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Pang Juan led elite forces from Zhao, Chu, Wei, and Yan in attacking Qin's Zhui, but failed to capture it;

sentences.zh: 移攻齊，取饒安。

translations.literal: shifted to attack Qi, captured Rao'an.
translations.idiomatic: then shifted to attack Qi and captured Rao'an.

sentences.zh: 五年，傅抵將，居平邑；

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Fu Di commanded, stationed at Pingyi;
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Fu Di commanded and was stationed at Pingyi;

sentences.zh: 慶舍將東陽河外師，守河梁。

translations.literal: Qing She commanded the Dongyang troops outside the river, defended the river bridge.
translations.idiomatic: Qing She commanded the Dongyang troops beyond the river, defending the river crossing.

sentences.zh: 六年，封長安君以饒。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, he enfeoffed the Lord of Chang'an with Rao.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, he granted Rao as fief to the Lord of Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 魏與趙鄴。

translations.literal: Wei met with Zhao at Ye.
translations.idiomatic: Wei met with Zhao at Ye.

sentences.zh: 九年，趙攻燕，取貍、陽城。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Zhao attacked Yan, captured Li and Yangcheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Zhao attacked Yan and captured Li and Yangcheng.

sentences.zh: 兵未罷，秦攻鄴，拔之。

translations.literal: The troops had not been disbanded when Qin attacked Ye, captured it.
translations.idiomatic: Before the troops could be disbanded, Qin attacked Ye and captured it.

sentences.zh: 悼襄王卒，子幽繆王遷立。

translations.literal: King Daoxiang died, his son King Youmiu Qian ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: King Daoxiang died. His son ascended the throne as King Youmiu.

sentences.zh: 幽繆王遷元年，城柏人。

translations.literal: In King Youmiu's first year, they fortified Baoren with city walls.
translations.idiomatic: In King Youmiu's first year, fortifications were built at Baoren.

sentences.zh: 二年，秦攻武城，扈輒率師救之，軍敗，死焉。

translations.literal: In the second year, Qin attacked Wucheng, Hu Zhe led troops to rescue it, the army was defeated, he died there.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Qin attacked Wucheng. Hu Zhe led troops to its rescue, but the army was defeated and he died in battle.

sentences.zh: 三年，秦攻赤麗、宜安，李牧率師與戰肥下，卻之。

translations.literal: In the third year, Qin attacked Chilli and Yian, Li Mu led troops and fought them at Fei below, repelled them.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Qin attacked Chilli and Yian. Li Mu led troops to fight them below Fei and drove them back.

sentences.zh: 封牧為武安君。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed Mu as Lord of Wuan.
translations.idiomatic: Mu was granted the title Lord of Wuan.

sentences.zh: 四年，秦攻番吾，李牧與之戰，卻之。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Qin attacked Fanwu, Li Mu fought them, repelled them.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Qin attacked Fanwu. Li Mu fought them and drove them back.

sentences.zh: 五年，代地大動，自樂徐以西，北至平陰，臺屋墻垣太半壞，地坼東西百三十步。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Dai territory had a great earthquake, from Le Xu west, north to Pingyin, terraces, houses, walls, more than half destroyed, the earth cracked east-west one hundred thirty paces.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, a massive earthquake struck Dai territory. From west of Le Xu north to Pingyin, terraces, houses, and walls were more than half destroyed. The earth split apart for one hundred thirty paces east to west.

sentences.zh: 六年，大饑，民訛言曰：「趙為號，秦為笑。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, great famine, the people spread rumors saying: 'Zhao makes the call, Qin laughs.'
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, a great famine struck. The people spread rumors saying: 'Zhao calls out, Qin laughs.'

sentences.zh: 以為不信，視地之生毛。」

translations.literal: 'To test if it's not believed, look for the earth growing hair.'
translations.idiomatic: 'To test if it's not credible, look for hair growing on the ground.'

sentences.zh: 七年，秦人攻趙，趙大將李牧、將軍司馬尚將，擊之。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Qin attacked Zhao, Zhao's great general Li Mu and general Sima Shang commanded, attacked them.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Qin attacked Zhao. Zhao's supreme commander Li Mu and general Sima Shang led the counterattack.

sentences.zh: 李牧誅，司馬尚免，趙怱及齊將顏聚代之。

translations.literal: Li Mu was executed, Sima Shang dismissed, Zhao Cong and Qi general Yan Ju replaced them.
translations.idiomatic: Li Mu was executed and Sima Shang dismissed. Zhao Cong and Qi's general Yan Ju took their places.

sentences.zh: 趙怱軍破，顏聚亡去。

translations.literal: Zhao Cong's army was broken, Yan Ju fled.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Cong's army was routed and Yan Ju fled.

sentences.zh: 以王遷降。

translations.literal: King Qian surrendered.
translations.idiomatic: King Qian surrendered to Qin.

sentences.zh: 八年十月，邯鄲為秦。

translations.literal: In the eighth year tenth month, Handan fell to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of the eighth year, Handan fell to Qin.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰。

translations.literal: The Grand Scribe says.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian remarks:

sentences.zh: 吾聞馮王孫曰：「趙王遷，其母倡也，嬖於悼襄王。

translations.literal: I heard Feng Wangsun say: 'King Qian of Zhao, his mother was a singing girl, favored by King Daoxiang.'
translations.idiomatic: I heard Feng Wangsun say: 'King Qian of Zhao's mother was a singing girl who found favor with King Daoxiang.'

sentences.zh: 悼襄王廢適子嘉而立遷。

translations.literal: King Daoxiang deposed the legitimate son Jia and established Qian.
translations.idiomatic: King Daoxiang deposed his legitimate heir Jia and installed Qian on the throne.

sentences.zh: 遷素無行，信讒，故誅其良將李牧，用郭開。」

translations.literal: Qian was habitually without conduct, believed slanderers, thus executed his good general Li Mu, employed Guo Kai.'
translations.idiomatic: Qian was habitually immoral and gullible to slanderers. Thus he executed his fine general Li Mu and employed the treacherous Guo Kai.'

sentences.zh: 豈不繆哉！

translations.literal: Was this not a grave error!
translations.idiomatic: How tragic a mistake!

sentences.zh: 秦既虜遷，趙之亡大夫共立嘉為王，王代六歲，秦進兵破嘉，遂滅趙以為郡。

translations.literal: After Qin had captured Qian, Zhao's exiled grandees together established Jia as king. He reigned in Dai for six years. Qin advanced troops, defeated Jia, and thus extinguished Zhao to make it a commandery.
translations.idiomatic: After Qin captured Qian, Zhao's exiled nobles united to establish Jia as king. He ruled in Dai for six years, but Qin advanced its armies, defeated Jia, and thus extinguished Zhao, reducing it to a mere commandery.
